results.description:
The Pharaoh Wilderness Area has fantastic hiking trails for both experienced and inexperienced hikers. Some people consider this area as the best trail system in the Adirondacks in regard to appealing destinations, trail maintenance, and design. Since a lot of people have asked about backpacking trips, we decided to do a beginner backpacking trip to Pharaoh Lake with the option to do day hikes, explore the area, camp and chill. This is a great place to rest, have lunch, and go swimming. Pharaoh Lake is breathtaking with its 100 foot depth, irregular shoreline, numerous islands, and unspoiled wilderness surrounding it.

TRIP DETAILS:

This is a beginner packpacking trip and will involve an easy 4.5 mile hike to our camp at Pharaoh Lake. After settling in, people will have the option of doing several hikes in the area, Fishing, BBQ'ing or just hanging out near the lake. During the day, we can chillax at the lake or hike up Pharaoh mountain. There is a 270 degree splendid view of the Adirondack Mountains, ponds, marshes and the 9 mile long Schroon lake.

Pharaoh Mountain Out and Back - (Intermediate) 2551 ft

Pharaoh Mountain to Crane Pond w/ Exploring - (Intermediate)

Pharaoh Lake Loop - (Moderate)

For more information on the hiking trails please click here

DIRECTIONS: (Beaver Pond Rd Access)

The approach is from NY Route 8 between the hamlets of Brant Lake and Hague. Turn onto Palisades Road approximately 6 mi northeast of the hamlet of Brant Lake. At 1.5 mi turn right on Beaver Pond Road which is the third right off Palisades Road. Go another 1.0 mi on Beaver Pond Road to Pharaoh Lake Road, which is now marked with a sign that simply says "Trail." Will update with Google Map GPS Coordinates later....

Disclaimer:

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.
results.name: Adirondack Pharaoh Lake Wilderness: Backpacking/Fishing (2-Nights)

INSTRUCTIONS: PLEASE READ (and follow) THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE OPTIMAL FUN!.

  Hello Cultured Families & Mini Movie Buffs! Here is a monthly event that joins together our "Cultured Kids go to..." & our "Mini-Movie Buffs" series! Let's go to MoMi!

The Museum of Moving Image in Astoria, Queens is the country's only museum dedicated to the art, history, technique, and technology of the moving image in all its forms. There are video games there, historical films being screened, artifacts from the famous movies and more!

I went to this museum a couple of months ago with my daughter, 7 and her friend and they had a blast. This place is great for kids 4 and up, and adults too! So please join us!

Admission:  Fridays from 4PM- 8PM is absolutely, 100% FREE!!!

RECOMMENDED AGE: 0-99 years old

EVENT TIME: 4 p.m.- 8 pm / until you have to go bye bye 

 Check out your local weather

Subway, bus, taxi, walking directions (copy and paste the address listed above into the destination field)

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO ATTEND HERE'S WHAT TO DO NEXT:

If you are 200% sure that you can attend then RSVP "YES".

Don't forget to keep your RSVP updated.*-)

Look to see who else will be attending, and if they live nearby maybe you can ride together.

If you have a last minute change in plans (2 hours before the event) please call the host/ organizer to let her know.

If you can't make it, please RSVP "NO."

 

Hope to see you there!

~*~Amanda

results.description:
North & South Fork: Wine & Beach
Friday, May 27 to Monday, May 30
Long Island NY: North & South Fork,
(Greenport, Shelter Island, Sag Harbor and Montauk)

Join us this Memorial Day Weekend as we explore all the cool areas of North and South Fork! We'll take you through the wineries of North Fork, out to the lighthouse and beaches of Montauk, to the happening village of Greenport, and finally to the quaint and relaxing Shelter Island. This a wonderful way to start a summer in New York!

Included
Round-trip transportation to/from NYC
3 Nights @ Waterfront Condos at Greenport
3 Continental Breakfasts
Round-trip ferry to Shelter Island
Transportation to all wineries and Montauk 
4 different winery tastings (5 wines per flight)
Carriage vineyard tour
Live music at vineyards

Note: Your spot is NOT confirmed unless you put down a deposit (click on below deposit link)  This trip is posted on Circletheworld.com and other Meetups.  Only 10 spots available and will sell out!

Sale Price: $649 (Sale Ends 4/17)
Base Price: $725 *Bring-A-Friend & Save* (ea SALE PRICE) 
(Above price 2/people per room w/matched roommate) 
$200 deposit to reserve your spot~! CLICK HERE
*See below for payment due dates and procedures*

Accommodations: Our Condos are waterfront in Greenport. Each will occupy 3 people. There are 2 full bathrooms, 1 bedroom with twin beds, 1 bedroom with a queen (ensuite bathroom), kitchen, living & dinning room as well as a private balcony. Other amenities on the property: Direct beach access, heated outdoor pool, free Wifi, flat screen televisions, awesome views, BBQ grills.

Friday, May 27-Depart NYC
We will depart NYC in our 15-passenger van at 5:30pm from a Columbus Circle Location. Depending on traffic, we should reach our condos in Greenport around 8pm. We will check into our rooms before going for dinner and evening out in the village of Greenport.

Saturday, May 28-North Fork Wineries & Greenport
After our continental breakfast, we will start our day on the North Fork Wine Trail! We will stop at a total of 3 wineries including one vineyard/cellar tour. Each winery will include a flight of 4-6 wines, some live music, and stunning views. Lunch will be your own picked out picnic lunch to be eaten at one of the wineries on outside picnic tables. We will also make stops at a farm stand, and our favorite pie stand. When we return to Greenport, you will have time to walk around town and check out the numerous quaint shops, galleries, and cafes. If you wanted, you will have an option to sign up for a Sunset Sail ($50) before our group dinner in Greenport.

Sunday, May 29-Montauk, East Hampton, and Wolffer Estate
After an early breakfast, we will drive to Montauk for the day! Here you will be able to enjoy the beautiful beach, lighthouse point, and lunch on the beach. In the mid afternoon, we will drive to East Hampton to enjoy the quaint shops and cafes-or to get a nice ice cream. On our return to Greenport, we will stop at the lovely Wolffer Estate Winery. The grounds of this estate makes you feel as if you are in the Napa region~!

Once we return to Greenport, we'll relax or explore more of Greenport before our group dinner.

Monday, May 30-Shelter Island & Sag Harbor
After breakfast we'll pack up our things and head to Shelter Island for the day! Shelter Island is just a short ferry ride from Greenport. Once here, we will settle on Crescent Beach. Enjoy lunch or cocktails at one of the hotel restaurants while enjoying the sandy beach. If you are in for some adventure, you can choose to do some kayaking or biking around the island. In the early afternoon we will drive to Sag Harbor to explore this lovely town before departing back to NYC, expected to arrive back around 8pm.

Payment Due Dates and Procedures
All payments must be made on time to secure your spot. You may pay the balance in full anytime on/before the first due date.

After deposit pay the balance in either 3 ways:
-Quick Chase Pay (Chase account not required)
-Send check to Circle The World P.O.Box 20484 NY, NY 10011
-Pay online through website (a 3% service fee will be added to total

Due Dates
$449/$525 4/24
results.name: 2 Spots Left! Bring-A-Friend & Save: North and South Fork Wine Memorial Weekend

If you've ever thought that there are too few opportunities to play Pathfinder Society Games in central Jersey, you're in luck. Timezone Gaming and Comics is hosting PFS night every other Friday at their store in Fords, NJ. New players are more than welcome and pathfinder as well as society rules will be taught. Create a new pathfinder character which you can then take with you to any other PFS game around the world.

If you have any preferences or restrictions on what scenarios you would like to play, please drop me a message and let me know. Otherwise I'll be selecting a mix of both the old and new, modules and scenarios.

Also, if Mondays aren't good for you, RSVP to this event anyway and post about your availability. Since this game is still just getting stated, we're still trying to find a day and time that works for most people. Nothing is set in stone yet.

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

----

Arrive at 5:45pm if you want to do some improv warmups.  The jam will start right at 6pm sharp!

----

Please, no outside food or water of any kind, including water bottles.  The Triple Crown offers food and drink discounts for those with this improv show.  They offer 10% off food, and $4 select draft beers.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
</a>

<a href="http://www.Facebook.com/events/480669228789732">www.Facebook.com/events/[masked]

www.MahoningDiT.com

They're back from the grave and ready to party!

This Memorial Day weekend (May 27th-29th), ZOMBIEFEST returns to the Mahoning Drive-in theater! Like last year's awesome event, Exhumed Films and the Mahoning will be presenting three big nights of living dead triple-bills featuring your favorite zombie classics on the largest outdoor movie screen in the area. All films will be screened on glorious 35mm and will be preceded by vintage genre movie trailers. Be advised: ZOMBIEFEST II is definitely not for the squeamish!

Tickets for each night are $10 per person. Camping on the drive-in lot is an additional $10.

The Mahoning Drive-In Theater is located on Seneca Road west of Lehighton, Pennsylvania. It was built in 1948, and opened for its first season the following year. Since then, it has entertained moviegoers for over half a century on the largest CinemaScope screen in Pennsylvania! We offer an exclusively retro 35mm film program, which is presented reel-to-reel via original 1940's Simplex projectors! Our goal; To deliver you a true love of film, and the nostalgic moviegoing experience you can only get at the drive-in!

HERE'S THE FILM LINE-UP FOR THE WEEKEND:

Friday, May 27th:

GATES OF HELL (1980)- The suicide of a priest unlocks the gates of hell and allows the dead to rise, a woman to vomit her guts out, maggots to rain and brains to be drilled spectacularly. Director Lucio Fulci's splatterific follow-up to ZOMBIE is a mad assemblage of nightmarish vignettes oozing with atmosphere, supernatural presence and pustulant, walking corpses. Starring Christopher George, Catriona MacColl, Giovanni Lombardo Radice and Fabio Frizzi's fabulous score.


https://youtu.be/6tGLr_HnMec


BURIAL GROUND (1981)- Love it or really love it, this is a movie that you will remember for the rest of your natural days -- and quite possibly should you ever dig your way out of the grave. This fan favorite has everything a rabid gore-hound can ask for (and more), and nothing resembling smart characters, plot or budget to get in the way of all the insane, bloody zombie carnage. There's also Peter Bark.

https://youtu.be/nB3jpozGjhk


NIGHT OF THE ZOMBIES (1980)- Could this incredible night of Italian zombie gut-munchers get any crazier? Answer: yes, it certainly can. Here's director Bruno (RATS: NIGHTS OF TERROR) Mattei's and screenwriter Claudio (TROLL 2) Fragasso's chomp at DAWN OF THE DEAD. Join a group of sweaty commandos as they fight flesh-eating zombies in New Guinea to the tune of Goblin's score for the Romero film.


https://youtu.be/6RUCuLnsLeA


Saturday, May 28th:

RETURN OF THE LIVING DEAD (1985)- The events depicted in NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD were real, and the folks at Uneeda Medical Supply can prove it. Of course they may inadvertently turn you into a brain-eating creature of the undead, and you'll go chasing your friends around the local mortuary, but at least somewhere in what's left of your mind you'll know zombies exist. Dan O' Bannon's ghoulishly awesome punk zombie romp returns with all the music by THE CRAMPS, TSOL and THE DAMNED you crave, kiddies.

https://youtu.be/347aL0NqWFU


THE CHILDREN (1980)- A bus full of innocent school kids passes through a cloud of nuclear radiation turning them all into little creeps with black fingernails who can kill with a touch. Watch out mom and dad! A bizarre, irreverent, spooky, fun treat. Harry Manfredini supplies the score that sounds a lot like his FRIDAY THE 13TH music.

https://youtu.be/ssva3IdZ1jI


THE DEATH WHEELERS [aka. PSYCHOMANIA] (1973)- The Living Dead, a gang of misanthropic, hell-raising bikers, make a pact with the devil (in the form of a frog!) for immortality to live (?) up to their name and continue their rip-roaring, two-wheeled rampage against everything. Directed by Don (KISS OF THE VAMPIRES) Sharp, this film is a pure exploitation kitsch delight. Featuring a memorable score by John Cameron.

https://youtu.be/gc8bHG4VB2w


Sunday, May 29th:

THE BEYOND (1981)- Lucio Fulci's grand masterpiece is back, and the gateways to hell are open again, leaving all sorts of rotting zombies, killer beasts and weird characters to do their thing. A non-stop, phantasmagorical assault of violent set-pieces, overblown bloodshed and eerie gothic strangeness centered around an old hotel built over a doorway to eternal damnation; confidently produced on a small budget and hauntingly scored. Starring David Warbeck, Catriona MacColl and Al Cliver.

https://youtu.be/ef0oH3ZizfI


DEATHDREAM (1974)- Bob (A CHRISTMAS STORY) Clark follows up CHILDREN SHOULDN'T PLAY WITH DEAD THINGS with this perfectly creepy and impressive update of "The Monkey's Paw" as a Vietnam war PTSD allegory. Effective early effects work by Tom Savini and a sound cast including John Marley, Lynn Carlin and Richard Backus make this low-budget shocker a true gem of '70's horror.

https://youtu.be/LCtBPG-t5-Q


SHOCK WAVES (1977)- The most striking underwater Nazi zombies (goggled, covered in yuck) you'll ever see stalk a group of unlucky vacationers (including THE DEAD ZONE's Brooke Adams) on a godforsaken island inhabited only by Peter Cushing's crazed SS Commander. Yep, you gotta see this one. Also starring John Carradine. Directed by Ken Weiderhorn.

https://youtu.be/XEXN4FLGtBk

 

Gates open at 6:00pm

Since 1948, The Mahoning Drive-In Theater has entertained theatergoers in the greater northeast for over 60 years, and is home to one of the largest CinemaScope screens in the county. 2016 is our 2nd season to feature an exclusively retro 35mm program! Our goal; To deliver you a true love of film, and the nostalgic moviegoing experience you can only get at the drive-in!

Be sure to bring your sleeping bags! We encourage camping on the lot. At just $10.00 per carload, you and your friends can keep the party pumping all night long!



Tickets for the triple-film zombie feature each night are just $10 per person!


Too much of a pus*y to cam out? NO PROBLEM! The Hampton Inn of Lehighton/Jim Thorpe is also offering discounted room rates for anyone who presents their ticket stub at the front desk!

For further info their phone number is (610)[masked] and contact email address is [masked] . My cell # again is (347) 523-3937.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9aaXJhjEU6E

www.GoingAttractions.com

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=evvLeMACnXk
results.name: ZOMBIEFEST II Drive-In Memorial Day WEEKEND!!

results.description:
Tickets: I highly recommend getting yours beforehand. You can purchase them at movieticket.com. We will be seeing the 6:55 session.

Meeting up with each other: I hope you are all psyched for the movie! Unfortunately this will not be reserved seating, so we are back to the prehistoric age of having to line up in advance to get good seats. The movie starts at 6:55 and they usually let people in a half an hour prior. For big movies like this, there is usually a place for people to line up before the theater opens. Considering how many we are and the fact that this is opening weekend, I highly recommend that everyone get there at six (or the closest to it that you can) so we all have the best chance of sitting together in good seats. Of course, we will try to reserve seats for everyone when we enter the theater, but it is unlikely that we will be able to do this for this many people. Let's all meet at 6:00 p.m. in the line (just ask the theater staff where that would be, as it varies). If you can't come at 6:00 p.m., then please meet us inside the theater. We will try to have a seat for you, but we cannot guarantee it. After we go in and claim our seats, we can take turns getting food and stuff. I suggest bringing a sweater of something to mark your place. 

Dinner: We will grab food after the movie at Lola's Mexican Kitchen. It is a short walk from the theater.

Friday, May 27, 2016

Start your weekend off with the Empire Steppers

Join us at the Social Butterfly in Brooklyn for some great after work dancing, great music and people.

They have a great menu to enjoy: Beef and turkey sliders, bbq, Thai and buffalo wings, chicken fingers, shrimp, chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits and more.  The average price of the dishes is $10 and there will be drink specials as well. Another venue has opened its doors to stepping; let's show our appreciation by supporting the bar to this free stepping event.  

The Social Butterfly

857 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

6pm - 10pm

No Cover Charge

C train to Clinton - Washington Avenue Station

SEE YOU ON THE DANCE FLOOR!

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

group.name: Fun & Games MeetUp - Tenafly (Northern New Jersey / NJ)

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Let's get together and trade some Disney pins!! Some people come with just a lanyard full of pins other come with a stack of books full of pins.  Either way we welcome you to our group.  We are happy to answer any questions that you may have about pins and will try to guide all of the new traders in a direction of years of fun and trading.  We will meet from 6-9PM in the food court just outside of the elevators.  We hope to see you there.

 

We ask that you not bring food since we are in the mall food court.  Please plan on buying something such as a drink at the very least so that we are actually adding to the mall's profits.  We are using their space after all for free.

 

I appreciate your RSVP so I know who to look for or not.

 

You can email me at [masked] anytime for a faster response.

My wife and I don't always get to the pin meet due to our kids social lives.   Other people do go, but if you are coming for the first time I want to make sure that we are there to greet you and make you feel comfortable.

 

Please feel free to email me with any questions that you may have.

 

Thanks,

Steven

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We now play with 3 different practice jerseys. RED uptown logo bibs, LIME GREEN, and BLUE bibs.  

• We will provide clean freshly laundered bibs for every game. However, to encourage a sense of community and keep cost low, we encourage members to take the bibs they've worn for the game home, wash and please return back to us. 


Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Friday soccer under the sky!

results.description:
Prepayment is required HERE 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

Prepayment is required HERE</a><a href="http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6038">

**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
Note: 

This is a German Movie Night presented by Goethe Institut. Many people simply go to see the movie, so don't expect as much socializing/meeting new people as on our monthly meetups. Sometimes a small group heads on out to have drinks afterwards though.

It is a public event, there is no specific area for our group.

The language of the movie is GERMAN, but it will have ENGLISH SUBTITLES. 

The movie starts at 06:30pm, please arrive early as oftentimes the place fills up and it's strictly first come first serve. If you arrive late, you may not get a seat.

Hotel Lux (2011 - 103min.) - directed by Leander Haußmann

Hans and Siggi perform brilliant parodies of Hitler and Stalin, which is why they have to leave Germany in 1933. On the run, they start a comical yet dangerous charade for freedom in Moscow’s famous Hotel Lux.

More info on the film on Wikipedia (in English, also available in German).

Is there a Cover charge?

No, the event is free.

Do I have to speak German to attend?

No. Just keep in mind that this movie is shown in German, with English subtitles.

How do I get there by subway?

4/5/6 & N/Q/R: Union Square - 2 Blocks away

L: 3rd Avenue or Union Square - 2 Blocks away

1/2/3 & A/C/E & F/M: Transfer to L at 14th Street

To contact Goethe Institut directly about this event, you can call them at[masked] or send an e-mail to [masked] 

Please enjoy the event, and as always, please update your RSVP if your plans change, it is highly appreciated and helps more than you may think.


Thomas

[masked]

[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in through the library. There is no specific area for us, it is a public event. Get there early, the seating is on a first-come-first-serve basis.
results.name: Free German Movie Night @ Goethe Institut: "Hotel Lux"

results.description:
Schedule

6:30-6:45 - meet at bench in front of museum store (see above)

6:45-MANUS x MACHINA Fashion in the Art of Technology at The Met

The Costume Institute's spring 2016 exhibition, presented in the Museum's Robert Lehman Wing, will explore how fashion designers are reconciling the handmade and the machine-made in the creation of haute couture and avant-garde ready-to-wear.

8:15-9:00 Psycho Barn on the Roof Deck


A large-scale sculpture by acclaimed British artist Cornelia Parker, inspired by the paintings of Edward Hopper and by two emblems of American architecture—the classic red barn and the Bates family's sinister mansion from Alfred Hitchcock's 1960 film Psycho—comprises the fourth annual installation of site-specific works commissioned for The Met's Iris and B. Gerald Cantor Roof Garden


9:00-9:15- Meet again on the front steps outside to go to Serafina for food or drinks.

We are a loose knit group of people who like going to museums.  We don't give tours and we don't follow a structure other than the *schedule* given above.  You are welcome to view the exhibits at your own pace.  The best way to make some new friends is to join us for food or drinks afterward.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Susan or John at the bench in the front of the museum store.  When you walk into the museum the museum store is on the right side of the lobby. Get your ticket and join us on the bench. We will wait til 645.
results.name: MANUS x MACHINA Fashion in the Age of Technology at The Met

group.name: The New York City Museum Group

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is a fun and different way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP (singles 21-49):

WOMEN get tickets HERE

MEN get tickets HERE

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize.  

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games    

• Scorecard Matching  

• Ice Breakers 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase: 

WOMEN get tickets HERE

MEN get tickets HERE

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Up to 40 singles will be attending. Ages will mostly be 20s-40s. Food and drink will be available for purchase.

WOMEN GET TICKETS AT THIS LINK - http://bit.ly/1O67M7B

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is a fun and different way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP (singles 21-49):

WOMEN get tickets HERE

MEN get tickets HERE

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize.  

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人，请准备现金，最好有零钱。在入场时找Lolo交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间5月27日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

Join us as we visit New York's famous Tibetan Museum. Located in the Chelsea area this museum is known for bringing the most trendiest arts from the east.

We will enjoy Tibetan fine art, historical and religious and enjoy the music and happy hour drinks.

We will meet at the bar and do a quick tour of the museum. When competed touring we enjoy the remaining of the night in the RMA bar area for socializing and drinking. We end our end out week of hard work with a friendly drink and zestful weekend start.


Rubin Exhibitions

Nepalese Seasons


Genesis Breyer P-Orridge


Masterworks of Himalayan


Sacred Spaces


Gateway of Himalayan Art


We meet in the cafe area and socialize until 7:30 pm. At that time, we will promptly start to tour the new an permanent exhibits.

Music:

Rubin's DJ Suspended for the Holiday weekend

This will be a perfect way to meet and greet some of the amazing members of EWNYC meetup. Many of us meet in passing while volunteering or gong to the movies. Let's get centered and better acquainted with volunteers.


Entrance: Free Friday Nights


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Night's Event - Itinerary

• Please note that we will be meeting in the lobby lounge area.

• Located on the ground level to the left of entry.

• We have a reserved area will be near the  Bar.

• Our meet up time is 6:30 pm Friday.

• We will spend the first hour as a "meet and greet".

• At this time Happy Hour should be taking place, Two for one on selected wines and beverages.

• I will introduce members and at 7:30 after finishing our drinks we will make our way to the top floor and experience the museum.


Olisa

results.description:
Memorial Day weekend Epic Adventure Trip. This event is for Via Ferrata Day and Night time climbing. I've done this and it was incredible. See below for details of what is via Ferrata.

If you are interested, contact me directly and advise if you are interested in both day time and night time. Please note, if it's your FIRST time, it's mandatory to do the day time in order to do the night time as well.

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY, the only thing is You CANNOT be AFRAID of heights!!

Personal Experience: For me this was An AMAZING experience. It was intense but I'm an adrenaline junkie, this is right up my alley.

This is a guided tour with all equipment provided: harness, helmet, caribiners etc.

Definition: Via ferrata (Italian for "iron road", plural vie ferrate or in English via ferratas) is a protected climbing route. The essence of a modern via ferrata is a steel cable which runs along the route and is periodically (every 3 to 10 metres (9.8 to 32.8 ft) fixed to the rock. Using a via ferrata kit, climbers can secure themselves to the cable, limiting any fall. The cable can also be used as aid to climbing, and additional climbing aids, such as iron rungs (stemples), pegs, carved steps and even ladders and bridges are often provided. They offer the relatively inexperienced a means of enjoying dramatic positions and accessing difficult peaks, normally the preserve of the serious mountaineer; although, as there is a need for a good head for heights and basic technique, the via ferrata can be seen as a distinct step up from ordinary mountain walking.

Location: Located in the Potomac Highlands region near Circleville, WV

Distance: from NY it's estimated about 7hour drive without stops.

Description and details: The Via Ferrata is a one of a kind adventure experience, offering a mile of fixed-anchor, professionally-guided rock climbing. During this 3.5-5 hour climb you’ll gain 1085 feet in elevation, cross a suspension bridge that is 150 feet high and 200 feet long, and reach exposed heights of 280 feet. All you need for this day on the rocks is some physical ability, an appreciation of the outdoors, and of course a desire to have a great day outside! The double-fin rocks provide the unique combination of physical challenge and overwhelming beauty.
Italian for ‘by way of iron’, the Via Ferrata is a permanently installed system of steel rungs and cables that allows you to climb up and over two towering rock fins. Not for the faint of heart, but well worth the effort.

Climb Duration

3.5 – 5 hours depending on group size and ability.

Difficulty Level
It‘s difficult to compare the Via Ferrata experience to anything else. It can be very demanding or not so demanding depending on one’s level of fitness. It can also be emotionally taxing depending on one’s level of comfort with heights. It is not recommended for those who are trying to overcome an intense fear of heights.

How high do we actually go?
All Via Ferrata climbers will experience heights of approximately 200 feet! The most adventurous climbers can take the extra challenge of completing the Head Wall, an additional 100 feet of vertical climbing.

What to Wear
Dress in layers so you can make adjustments as you warm up and cool down.
You should dress for movement and according to the weather. The temperature tends to be about 10°F cooler in the mountains, and may be even cooler due to wind. In general wear comfy, loose-fitting clothing that does not restrict your movement. Short shorts are not recommended and many climbers prefer to wear pants or capris to keep their knees covered.
Footwear
Sturdy athletic shoes or lightweight hiking shoes/boots. No sandals (including Chacos or Tevas), or FiveFingers shoes.

Bring with You
Waivers, small daypack, 2-quarts of water, trail snacks, sunscreen, camera/GoPro (optional, must be secured), rain gear (if necessary), fingerless bicycle style gloves (recommended).

Can I bring my own gear / Can I get a discount for bringing my own gear?
You can bring a GoPro or camera and we can provide a helmet with a GoPro mount on it. Unfortunately we cannot allow you to use your own helmet or harness. We appreciate and understand the desire and preference of using your own gear if you have it, but in order to comply with our insurance policy, we require everyone who comes to experience the Via Ferrata to use the gear that is supplied by staff.

Can I get off the Via once I’ve started the climb?
Yes. There are two escape points on the Via Ferrata, should you decide you don’t want to continue.

I’m scared of heights, should I climb the Via Ferrata?
If you have a general, healthy fear of heights you should be okay. If you are intensely scared of heights, this might not be the best activity for you.

Price: Day time Via Ferrata $115
Night time via Ferrata $150. Please note, if it's your first time doing Via Ferrata with this company, you can NOT sign up for the night time without doing day time Via Ferrata.
You can choose to do both or just the daytime.

How do I sign up and confirm my attendance?
Please contact me directly, you are not confirm unless I receive payment. Payments can be submitted via PayPal.

Deadline: May 1, to confirm your attendance.

Cancellation/Refund policy: 3 Weeks prior to the event (May 29) notice in advance for a full refund. If you decide to cancel or change your mind on the day off, NO you will not receive any refund. If at any point you decide to take the escape point, NO you will not receive any discount or refund.

Group climb details: They can take 14 max at a time, group this size will have both a guide and a sweep (meaning a guide that stays in the back of the group.) Group with less than 14 people will only have the lead guide.

Lodging: I will rent a cabin, depends on how many people signs up. I will need confirmation by May 7, after that you will need to find your own accommodation.

Getting there: You are responsible for your own transportation or car pooling. That you need to coordinate on your own, or ask the people that are definitely coming to this trip.

Further details: once I have confirmed attendees, I will send a group message with all the logistics. Location, Meetup point etc.

Activities: As noted on the description, day time Via Ferrata is about 3.5 - 5 hours depending on the group. There's hiking portion on Via Ferrata. Other activities for the weekend: hiking, ziplining, exploring or kayaking, as of right now all other activities aside from Via Ferrata are tentative. Once I have a solid plan on hike/Zipline/ kayak, I will keep you all posted.

Schedule:

Friday, May 27 leave the city ( everyone on own schedule)

Saturday, May 28, Hike (TBD) pls note, my hikes are normally fast and strenuous, MUST be self sufficient and can hold your own, NO sweep and NOT a beginners hike. As of now the hike plan is in progress, just be prepared to put in mileage, I have a very bad tendency of extending my hikes, it can be anywhere 10-18 miles more or less. Be prepared! Have your own map of West, VA, proper gear,: I.e headlamp, backpack, emergency kit, water, etc. Fair warning, MUST be able to hold your own, or have a buddy system. Learn topography and must be an experience hiker. I will list other options for this day in case you don't want to join the hike.

Saturday May 28 VIA FERRATA- Day time. 1:00PM

Sunday, May 29 - Hiking

9:00AM be at the trailhead

Start at Little Devils Stairs, I'm planning on summiting, Hog Mountain elevation of 3,474 take the Rattlesnake Point trail to Pitney Ridge Trail. Have lunch at Range View. Take the Trail run road, summit Pignut Mountain elevation 2,531, then head to Little Stairs Trail back to parking lot. Hike is estimated about 14 miles, however, I might extend it. Gear to bring

Backpack Emergency kit

Headlamp

Water

Snacks

Hiking boots, poles if you use them

Hat, glasses, insect repellent, sunscreen Brian your own map.

IMPORTANT: As noted, there is no sweep on this hike, my hikes are generally fast. Please learn topography, bring your own map, have a buddy system. Learn exit points.

Monday, May 30 - Car-iking, hiking in a car, aka sight seeing. Hit a few scenic spots and go exploring.

NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER

Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Join us for the NY Shamanic Healing Circle with Irma StarSpirit Woman

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

Dates for circle are: 1/29, 2/26, 3/25, 4/29, 5/27, 6/24

Location: YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W. 29th St, 2nd Fl., #201 (btw. 7th & 8th Ave), NYC.(door closes at 7:30pm)

Exchange: $20

Register to hold space email: [masked]

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com

This open mic, exclusively features original electronic music in a cool cafe setting. Other artists have opportunities to perform their music and poetry. Now electronic musicians have their space to play! This is a venue for people who are at the beginning stages of gigging, a place for a seasoned producers to tryout a side-project, a home for beatheads who need new music constantly, a gallery for visual artists who love electronic, and a forum for creating electronic music and making connections. Come be a part of this underground electronic event. Pre-register for a 15 minute slot. Walk-ins welcome. We encourage all genres and BPMs. FREE. Beer, coffee, wine, food for sale. All ages. 21+ to drink.

Our wonderful host, who has seen us from 0 likes to over 120, has been Muchmore's.

Muchmore's. 2 Havemeyer St. Brooklyn. 5 minute walk from Lorimer (L), Metropolitan (G) stations.

results.description:
Maasai Mamas!!! Spring time in Brooklyn is here!!!  That means great weather, festivals, cook-outs, parks and playdates!!!  We have a month before DanceAfrica 2016, lets make sure we make the time to get to know one another so we can celebrate upcoming events with familiarity!!

Senegal: Doors of Ancient Futures (Performance)

Artistic Director Abdel R. Salaam and Artistic Director Emeritus Chuck Davis

The nation’s largest festival dedicated to African dance returns for its 39th year, featuring new artistic director Abdel R. Salaam. This beloved annual tradition brings together performance, art, film, and an array of community events for an exhilarating celebration of culture from Africa and its diaspora.

This year, DanceAfrica offers a taste of the rhythm, movement, and spirit of Senegal past and present, welcoming two Dakar-based companies: Les Ballets de la Renaissance Africaine “Waato Siita”, featuring the best percussionists and dancers from Senegal; Compagnie Tenane, a dynamic troupe that mixes contemporary styles and traditional Senegalese movement; BAM/Restoration DanceAfrica Ensemble; Germaine Acogny; and Dyane Harvey-Salaam.

If we buy 4 or more tickets, we save 15%-30%

Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos. 

The Place: Amada is an Andalusian tapas bar and restaurant in a contemporary setting in the thriving neighborhood of Battery Park in Downtown New York City. Chef Jose Garces embraces the rich traditions of Spanish gastronomy while incorporating modern tapas.

http://newyork.amadarestaurant.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
We cover Jazz Standards from the Real Books with focus on the 5th and 6th editions. Welcome horn players, bass, drums, keyboard, guitars and even occasional jazz vocalists, although this venue is more for playing of instruments. The goal is to learn to improvise over changing chords, some complex, while developing your listening and playing skills. We post a suggested set list and participants come prepared to play the songs.

One (1) drummer and one (1) bassist per session only so please communicate with each other and rotate sessions as required. We post some songs to the MORE>FILES section of the web page, but musicians are responsible for bringing their own music. You must RSVP in order to attend as we need to plan out who is attending for Studio space to accommodate musicians. The studio charges $10 per musician.
results.name: Long Island Jazz Jam - Friday's at 7pm

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

In our fast-paced world, are you looking to find more inner peace? Chanting this once-secret name for God, HU, has helped people throughout time find inner peace and divine love. Maybe it will help you! The Community HU Song is an occasion for every Soul, regardless of their spiritual path, to share in the gift of HU. Free! All are welcome to this half-hour HU Song.

There will be light refreshments and an opportunity to socialize at the conclusion.

For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org and MiraclesinYourLife.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visitwww.eckankar-nj.org.

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Mike Vecchione (Comedy Central), JJ Ramirez, JP Justice! Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Dangerfield's Comedy Meetup! Free Tickets! 2 Drink Minimum

results.description:
The Three Angels’ Chorale will perform "The Nations Will Praise You." A sacred concert. FREE ADMISSION FOR ALL...

Members of the choir come from four continents and speak a variety of languages. Under the direction of Betsy Mayer, the choir shares sacred music that reflects their commitment to Jesus and touches hearts and minds of all ages and backgrounds. The Three Angels’ Chorale is an outreach of Hartland College, in Rapidan, Virginia, a Seventh-day Adventist missionary training school that prepares young people for ministry in variety of majors: education, media, midwifery, health ministry, pastoral evangelism and Bible instruction.

Love offering will be collected.
results.name: Sacred Concert by Hartland Choir - "Nations Will Praise You"

results.description:
Hey, let's get together at the Zeppelin Hall Beer Garden, drink beer, be merry, and maybe ... if time or occasion permits then possibly talk about running as well! 

Whether you are a staple at our morning or evening runs, haven't been out for a while, or haven't come to a meetup run yet, this is a great chance to get together. If you have joined the group and are on the fence about coming out for a run, come out, grab a beer, and ask us any questions you have on how often we run, pace, etc. We have a group of experienced runners who offer great advice (btw do not get some of us started) and everyone will feel right at home.

Any questions, ask in a comment below ... or ask us at the Beer Garden! Prost!

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
Havening: How Touch Heals Trauma In The Brain W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

Havening is a new form of holistic therapy that is just beginning to be taught in the United States.  It is a psychosensory therapy that creates its effect through touch.  Creating a “safe haven” through applying certain forms of touch causes formerly “permanent” trauma, which exists physically in specific places in the brain, to dissolve, thereby eliminating the link between the original trauma and the disturbing emotional reactions that people have when they become triggered.

Join us to update your knowledge about how seemingly mystical, unscientific, holistic therapies such as EFT, EMDR, and now Havening, have a an increasingly documented, solid scientific basis in neuroscience.

Tonight’s program will give you a look into the future of alternative, holistic evidence-based therapies.  We begin at 7:30PM.

Your facilitator: http://DrJayKantor.Com .
results.name: Havening: How Touch Heals Trauma In The Brain W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

results.description:
On Friday, May 27th at 7:30 PM, The Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades (UUCP) will be showing a screening of the award-winning documentary “Just Eat It”, a 74-minute film about food waste and food rescue.

Did you know that 40% of all food grown and raised in the U.S. is not consumed? Farmers are paid by the government to deliberately dump their crops and allow them to rot in fields. Supermarkets throw out perfectly good food on a daily basis into dumpsters, much of it not in biodegradable containers to be brought to landfills.

Meanwhile in 2014 there were 48.1 million people living in food insecure households, 16.2 million of them were children. Why is this happening in the richest nation in the world? And more importantly, what are our personal and collective roles in ending it? Filmmakers and food lovers, Jen and Grant dive into the issue of food waste from farm and retail, right to the back of their own fridge. In a deliciously entertaining challenge, they pledge to quit grocery shopping and survive only on discarded food.

Join us for this informative and compelling film. There will be a discussion and refreshments after the film.
results.name: "JUST EAT IT" Documentary

group.name: Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Friday night pickup is here - come out and join us!


60-75 min game: 7v7 with 2 teams. Be there 10mins early and ready to start at 8pm - if not you'll need to wait until a break in play to join the game.

Bring a White AND Black t-shirt!

See you at the pitch!

****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Matches are in Chinatown Fri (8.00pm)

• Teams are 7v7, 60-75min game 


• Played under Lights. Goals are 6'x12' (7v7 size)


•  Games are played in a friendly & fun environment


• No rough tackles/play, a good attitude is appreciated

Payment goes toward field permit, light rentals, meetup fees and other equipment


LOCATION:

The field is located in Manhattan's Grand St field (Chrystie/Grand). <a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?q=stanton+and+chrystie+new+york&hl=en&ll=40.72238,-73.991675&spn=0.009969,0.022488&sll=40.721226,-73.992276&sspn=0.009969,0.022488&t=h&hnear=Chrystie+St+%26+Stanton+St,+New+York,+10002&z=16"></a>

Cheers!

Grand FC // Group Stage Soccer


Visit us here. Join us on: facebook.

By joining this group and participating in events, you certify that you have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with your participation. You have read and agree the Waiver Of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement.

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/13230291_1148593101886276_3032172837618885805_n.jpg?oh=663807bb6ec8a743f281ea2eb6d98a1d&oe=579D7E2D

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Breakaway) w/ Adriana and Shoshi
9:30pm-10:00pm - DJ Flouer
10:00pm-11:00pm - LIVE MUSIC!! w/ Shawn Hershey and Josh Fialkoff of The Fried Bananas
11:00pm-11:30pm - DJ Flouer
11:30pm-12:30am - Shawn Hershey and Josh Fialkoff
12:30am-1:30am - DJ Flouer

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $16 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $24 for the night!

****************************************************************************

ABOUT THE BAND:
Many years ago in a land far away, a band of incredible talent was born. It just so happens that The Fried Bananas was born that year as well. The spot: Shawn Hershey’s living room. The event: a 30th birthday celebration. The reason: to make beautiful music together. Since then, The Fried Bananas have traveled the country with a single mission – to swing harder than a 5-year-old at recess and, more importantly, to make people dance!

NEXT MONTH'S LIVE BAND:
June 24th will feature Jessy Carolina and the Hot Mess. Stay tuned for more details!


****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/about/locations

venue.name: La Fama - Salsa Social

results.description:
****This is our LAST event before breaking for the Summer.  We may come back in September depending on the Salsa Dancing Forecast.  Thank you for partying with us for the last 10 months!  *****

Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/
results.name: Salsa Dancing Party in NYC

group.name: Salsa Dance Parties in New York City

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results! 

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited..  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1Tec8f7

Meetup starts at 9 in the front bar

Seating in the backroom starts at 930 and the show starts shortly after. 

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. 

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager! - FREE Meetup & COMEDY SHOW
