results.description:
Will you be around this Memorial Day weekend? We're getting together for memorable (hehe) dim sum at Joy Luck Palace, the new highly touted dim sum restaurant, and we'd love it if you'd join us! We've scheduled this for 11am and the timing is critical for two reasons: we anticipate a wait for a large table to become available (always the case at dim sum) and we want to get a jump on the best and freshest items during prime time - so please come on time.

- Everyone will share the dishes that we order. Expect the cost to be approximately $25-$30 per person including tax and tip. In order to cover our fees to Meetup.com, we charge members $1 over the food/tax/tip bill.

- Drinks (other than tea, of course) will go on a separate check and must be paid for individually by those who have ordered them.

- Please bring cash, small bills preferred.

- RSVP etiquette: We often have a waitlist of people wanting to join us. Please RSVP responsibly. If you must change your RSVP, please do so at least 24 hours before the scheduled time. If you have an emergency the day of, please change your RSVP and also send the organizer an email through the site.

Need some inducement? Check out the photo I took on my last visit there.

We're looking forward to dining with you!

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction class to Lyndhurst Meditation. This class gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth.

At Lyndhurst Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection.

Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life while meeting like minded people like yourself! Deeply examine and cleanse your self to find absolute peace and freedom!

If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 306 Ridge Rd, Lyndhurst, NJ 07071. Our meditation center is located across the stress from Wendy's. You can park in the front and additional free parking is located in the rear of the building. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have plans for the day please say so before the meetup starts so we can accommodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Lyndhurst Meditation you can call our center to have a free personal introduction today! Lyndhurst Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Let's discuss the concepts of Egoism Vs. Altruism: What do these terms mean? Which should guide one's moral choices?  What consequences, personally and socially, do they lead to? What types of political systems do each imply?

(As always, on your way in, please buy something from the Deli, if only a water or a coffee, so we don't get kicked out!)
results.how_to_find_us: Go upstairs and find the table filled with very intelligent-looking people!
results.name: Egoism Vs. Altruism

results.description:
I know we still feel that we are not having enough Asian food lol, but to make you miss and love Asian food even more, we will go for Brazilian food this time ( I'm just kidding, Brazilian food is awesome :p)  

I randomly looked up the place called Berimbau Do Brasil and I immediately feel like I want to give it try, so come join me! 

Popular dish include but not limited to:

Sea food stew 

Fraldinha berimbau - skirt steak w/ mushroom sauce, yucca fries, collard greens

tuna tartare, bacalhau and açaí caipirinha ( I believe the last one is the drink) 

Chicken Stew & Okra

Pao De Queijo ( not sure what it is, google it yourself lol) 


Pastel

Açaí Bowl 

I am not suggesting you to get drunk during the lunch time but... here you go, Batida de Coco

You know what, organizing brunch is fun, but it's probably not a good idea to do it around 10:30pm, because I AM HUNGRY!!  So I am going to bed now in case I will go grab any food...   See you guys :) 


Wait, who's gonna read that far... :p

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you want to energize after a long work day

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music

- if you think fitness doesn't mean just lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our other BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!

results.description:
It's time to gear up and fight for your side! War has been declared! Red Team VS Blue Team! Here begins the first battle to see whose the superior team. Who will win and who shall lose? Now it's time to start Nerf season in this group. Why not begin with a classic red vs blue style war? In this battle you will choose a side or choose to be both. The choice is yours. In this battle, only one wins..
RULES:
- Nerf or foam dart gun of your choice, heck even bring a melee weapon if you want as long as it's safe to use. No real ones please.
- At least bring some type of clothing or attire that shows which team you belong in. You can bring both colors if you choose to.
- No physical fighting, we just want to have fun and enjoy the game.
- Eyewear, it's important to have eyewear to prevent imjury at the eyes.
- water, you'll need your energy.
-if you get shot once you must call your shots! no cheating
- have fun and cooperate with each other.
- Oh and you'll need darts of course.

So let the war begin! winner of the first battle shall be determined! We will meet by the east 83rd side Fountain of the Metropolitan Museum of Modern art. I'll leave my number incase anyone gets lost or can't find us.
[masked]
Have fun everyone! hope to see you at the battlefield!
results.name: Red Vs Blue Nerf War Part 1: Dawn of War

results.description:
Dharma Gentle
Saturday May 14, 12pm - 1:30pm

Om Namah Sivaya!

I'm thrilled to announce that Dharma Gentle Yoga classes start at the North Hudson Park! Have you thought about starting yoga, but were not sure what class would be right?

Or are you recovering from an injury? Or do you have back or neck pain?

Or maybe you just want to relax and renew after a long week!

Dharma Gentle is perfect for you, and may be just what you have been looking for!

This healing session is appropriate for all ages, who wish to finally add the healing qualities of yoga into their lives. We move the body through the classical poses very slowly, gently and conscientiously. Rests are taken between poses as the body moves towards inner introspection on a physical and meditative level. This class is highly beneficial for those returning from an illness or injury, or who haven’t moved in a long time. It is recommended for those who are looking for a gentle class. Everyone will leave feeling refreshed and relaxed. Register NOW and join us this Saturday. Relax and refresh!

Please share with your friends and feel free to invite them! :)

We look forward to see you on the mat for this beautiful relaxing class!

Lot's of love from my heart to yours.

Namaste, Burcu Gokcek *Pls DO NOT forget your Yoga mats.

(Dharma Gentle will prepare you for Dharma Level I)

..................................................................................................

***Donation: You may donate what ever comes from your heart! Your donations help us to offer more effordable yoga classes. ......................................................................................

*** Please arrive at least 5 minutes before start. We will meeting in front of the stone house by the lake!

* PleaseDO NOT eat anything before the practice. Yoga should done on an empty stomach.

..............................................................................................
Like us on Facebook and follow the announcements!

link: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hatha-Raja-Yoga-with-Burcu-Gokcek/351314568364431?ref=bookmarks

...........................................................................................

What is Dharma Yoga?

Dharma Yoga is a graceful, yet challenging form of yoga based on Sri Dharma Mittra’s almost fifty years of practice of classical yoga. The practice is appropriate for students of all levels, from beginner to lifelong practitioners and accessible to so many because it meets each student where they are and according to their condition. As students move through the different series, they are encouraged to go deeper and experience the practice in a meditative and spiritual way. Sri Dharma’s passion for helping students go deeper in their practice using only the best and most efficient techniques with the ultimate goal of Self-realization (gaining absolute knowledge of the True Self) is reflected in all aspects of the Dharma Yoga system.

Dharma Yoga has roots in all nine forms of yoga, including Hatha, Raja, Karma, Kriya, Bhakti, Japa, Laya and Jnana, as well as a focus on the Eight Limbs of Yoga (Patanjali’s Ashtanga Yoga) with great emphasis placed on Yama and Niyama. Sri Dharma was given an extraordinary gift of knowledge in receiving yoga directly from his Guru, Sri Swami Kailashananda a.k.a. Yogi Gupta, for over a decade beginning in the early 1960′s. During this period of intense study, Sri Dharma was exposed to various yoga techniques that he has refined over an almost half century of practice and teaching into the Dharma Yoga he and his certified teachers the world over continue to share with their students each day.

In essence, Dharma Yoga is a system of classical Hatha-Raja Yoga. A devotional practice that emphasizes good health, a clear mind and a kind heart. The method weaves together many teachings in order to bring all students closer to the goal of Self-realization.
results.name: North Hudson Park Yoga: SATURDAY Noon Dharma Gentle  12pm-1:30pm!

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT.

BRING SUN PROTECTION, COMFORTABLE WALKING SHOES, LUNCH, WATER, AND AN EXTRA LAYER OF CLOTHING. WE WILL BE WALKING IN THE SHADE AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will occasionally comment on some things (the architecture and social history of buildings) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. WE WILL, ONCE IN A WHILE, STOP AT POINTS OF INTEREST.

IF YOU CAN'T KEEP UP WITH A FIVE MILE, MODERATE PACED WALK WITH SOME UPS AND DOWNS, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU.

We don't have to pay to enter the grounds of the Lyndhurst Estate because there is no admission fee for those who walk in.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo.

Description: After meeting at the Irvington Metro-North train station, we'll then walk past historically significant houses/mansions designed by famous architects.

We'll first walk through Irvington's Historic District and then go to the Lyndhurst Estate, which is a 67-acre estate, overlooking the Hudson River. The Lyndhurst Estate (named after the Linden trees planted on the estate) has a Gothic mansion, carriage house, 19th century bowling alley, old greenhouse and a park-like landscape.

We'll be having lunch on the grounds of the picturesque Lyndhurst Estate. For lunchtime, bring a blanket or something to sit on the grass because there are not many benches or rocks to sit on around the estate. There also is no place to buy lunch at the Lyndhurst Estate. After we eat lunch, we'll explore the beautiful grounds of the Lyndhurst Estate. The lovely Rose Garden should be in full bloom.

Afterwards, we'll go past Villa Lewaro, which is a sumptuous 34-room white stucco mansion with a red tile roof. This paliatial mansion was designated a National Historic Landmark in 1976.

Finally, we'll walk past the Armour-Stiner House, also known as the Octagon House, which is a unique octagon-shaped and domed Victorian style house. This house is also a National Historic Landmark.

We'll occasionally be walking on the Old Croton Aqueduct (a wide dirt trail), which will connect us to historic mansions/houses, but we'll mostly be walking on paved trails or sidewalks.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (before lunch) at 12:15 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to the Red Barn Bakery at 4 South Astor Street, Irvington, NY 10533. The Red Barn Bakery is at the southern end of the Irvington Metro-North train station. (If the train is late, the organizer will wait for the late-arriving train.)

Before the walk, restrooms are available in the Red Barn Bakery. There are also restrooms available at the Irvington Public Library, which is next to the train station. Later on, restrooms will be available at two locations on the Lyndhurst Estate.

Below is outside of the entrance to the Red Barn Bakery in Irvington, NY.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees

BELOW ARE THE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS:

Public Transportation by Metro-North:  Take the No. 1 subway train to Marble Hill/225th Street, which is one block from the Metro-North's Marble Hill station. (According to the MTA website, the No. 1 subway train is running normally on Saturday, May 28th.)

Then take the 11:42 AM Metro-North train from Marble Hill to Irvington, arriving at 12:09 PM. Before boarding the train, buy a ticket at the Marble Hill station's vending machine. Get a ticket from Marble Hill to Irvington (Regular fare is $3.75 one way; senior fare [65 years and older] is $1.75 one way). You can buy two tickets (one for Marble Hill to Irvington and one for Irvington back to Marble Hill). Purchasing a regular fare ticket  (until 65 years old) on board the train is considerably more expensive. However, seniors citizens who show the proper identification may purchase a ticket on board the train without paying the penalty of the higher on board prices. (This Marble Hill Metro-North station is a good option for those who live on the West Side of Manhattan, have easy access to the No. 1 subway train, or want to save some money.)

More Public Transportation Options by Metro-North: You can also take this Metro-North train from several other stations, including Grand Central Terminal and 125th Street in Harlem. If you take the train from Grand Central Terminal, the fare will be higher than taking the train from Marble Hill. The fare depends on the train zone. From Grand Central Terminal, take the 11:20 AM Croton Harmon train that stops in Irvington at 12:09 PM.

Below is a schedule of Metro-North's Hudson Line on the weekend.

http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/pdf/HUD_SS_APR32016.pdf

Public Transportation by bee-line (Westchester County) Bus:

If you want, you can take the bee-line bus instead of the Metro-North train. From the last stop on the No. 1 subway train (West 242nd Street and Broadway), you can take the bee-line Route 1W bus on Saturday at 11:00 AM, arriving in Irvington (North Broadway and Main Street) at 11:47 AM. After getting off the bus, then walk down Main Street (which is several blocks) to the Irvington Train Station. The bee-line buses use the NYC Metro Card, so you can use the transfer from the No. 1 subway line to the 1W bee-line bus. This is only one fare.

(According to the MTA website, the No. 1 subway train is running normally on Saturday, May 28th.)

Going back home, the bee-line bus stops in Irvington at 4:13 PM, arriving back at West 242nd Street/Broadway at 5:05 PM OR the bee-line bus stops in Irvington at 5:25 PM, arriving back at West 242nd Street/Broadway at 6:16 PM.

Below is a schedule of the bee-line Route 1W Bus on the weekend.

http://transportation.westchestergov.com/images/stories/Schedules/Rte1_1C_1T_1W_1XSpring2016.pdf

The bee-line bus takes pay-per-ride and unlimited Metro-Cards.

http://transportation.westchestergov.com/bee-line/fares-and-metrocard


Driving Directions: You can park your car for the entire walk at the Irvington Metro-North parking lot, which is free on the weekends. However, read carefully all the parking signs. For example, if you have a large vehicle don't park in a parking spot reserved for a compact vehicle. Wait for the train people outside of the Red Barn Bakery, near southern end of the station.

Finishing Time/Place:  We will be finishing back at the Irvington Metro-North station at about 4:30 PM. The return train arrives at Irvington at 4:48 PM, stopping in Marble Hill at 5:15 PM and Grand Central Terminal at 5:42 PM.

Rainy weather or other bad weather conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy weather or other bad weather conditions or the forecast is for rainy weather or other bad weather conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning (before 9:00 AM). If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.

Below is the Lyndhurst Mansion and Estate, the former country home of Jay Gould.

Below is a political cartoon about Jay Gould. (Source Puck Magazine,  March 29, 1882)

Below is Villa Lewaro, which was originally owned by entrepreneur Madam C. J. Walker and is now privately owned.

Below was Madam C. J. Walker at the wheel of her Waverly Electric car, circa 1913. She owned three automobiles.


Below was one of Madam C.J. Walker's hair products.


Below is the Octagon House, which is now privately owned.

Whether you’re new to fitness or have been working out for years, NYC In Your 20s is offering New Yorkers of all shapes, sizes and abilities FREE workout motivation every Saturday at 12:30 PM for six weeks, starting April 16, 2016.

NYC In Your 20s is helping New Yorkers get beach body ready by hosting their first annual fitness classes.  Over the course of six weeks, certified fitness trainer and nutritionist Oscar Flores and fitness instructor Bakari Taylor guide students through a warm-up before blasting through a series of fun, high-low impact choreographed workouts.  Suitable for people of all levels and free for everyone.  Sense of humor and flexible workout clothing required!

results.description:
Our last 'Brooklyn Museum' Scavenger Hunt Meetup was a big hit so we're doing it again! 

This is an INDOOR hunt and includes admission to the Brooklyn Museum. We will put together groups and you will receive a series of clues and perform mental and physical (nothing too strenuous) challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team or an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

*MUST PREPAY HERE

*Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET TICKETS HERE

*$35-$40 depending upon how early you purchase. NO tix sold at door. 

FAQs:

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

What if it rains? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

How many people are attending? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 40 members attending. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP.

PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/May-28-2016_at_1230PM
results.name: Brooklyn Museum Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

results.description:
Our last 'Brooklyn Museum' Scavenger Hunt Meetup was a big hit so we're doing it again! 

This is an INDOOR hunt and includes admission to the Brooklyn Museum. We will put together groups and you will receive a series of clues and perform mental and physical (nothing too strenuous) challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team or an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

*MUST PREPAY HERE

*Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET TICKETS HERE

*$35-$40 depending upon how early you purchase. NO tix sold at door. 

FAQs:

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

What if it rains? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

How many people are attending? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 40 members attending. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP.

results.description:
We're just weeks away from our seventh season's start!

Join us for the Season Opener at your assigned site in Bed-Stuy from 1:00 to 3:00 PM* on Saturday, May 28:

• Jackie Robinson Tennis Club: 341 Malcolm X Blvd

• Lafayette Gardens Tennis Club: West side of Classon between Lafayette & Dekalb

• Marcy Tennis Club: 753 Myrtle Ave

• Sumner Tennis Club: East side of Throop between Myrtle & Park

• Tompkins Tennis Club: 105 Tompkins Ave

*Volunteers should arrive by 12:30.


Register your child for free tennis:

www.kingcountytennisleague.org/register

Register to volunteer with us:

www.kingscountytennisleague.org/volunteer

results.description:
Bright Greetings Sweet Souls,

I'm excited to announce 4 new healing activations & vibrational upgrades online gatherings designed to assist you in releasing the past & embodying a greater sense of ease, peace, space, & grace in the eternal now!

Many of you are sharing that sometimes it feels like you're taking 2 steps forward & 1 step backwards.

That's totally ok & you can never go back to the old ways of being here even if you tried. You are making spiritual progress even if it feels like you're not.

Come play with me in the quantum field of pleasure & magical possibilities & reset your entire reality!

These sacred gatherings will vibrationally support you & allow you to feel safe, empowered, & connected to source so you can follow your soul whispers & take inspired action at accelerated speed without having to wait for years or lifetimes for miracles to show up for you as if by MAGIC!

Join these online calls by phone, skype, or the webcast especially If you've been feeling unsettled & uncomfortable living in these times of great uncertainty duringf this great shift of consciousness on planet earth!

Creating a rewarding life doesn't have to feel hard or take a long time to manifest when you're aligned with the truth & remembrance of who you & why you've come here.

Each time you receive these vibrational upgrades, it supports your spiritual evolution to help you rise above chaos & tribal consciousness & embody a higher vibrational essence to see all of life around you from a higher, vaster, & broader perspective.

Listen to a recent live healing activation on the Ascension Show Telesummit Here: 

https://www.freeconferencecallhd.com/playback.html?n=HVQBg%2FjN409

Here's a recent client testimonial :

“Hi Vandana, I bought your telesummit package after hearing your interview with Darius on the You Wealth Revolution Show and booked my first session the next morning. It was a wonderful clearing! I Spent the next two days sleeping and cleansing & even lost 1 ½ pounds. I really loved it & still listen daily to your guided meditation mp3s and continuing to see positive changes in my life… my attitude is changing & I’ve really shifted a lot! I even got a job contract that is helping me financially…this is so wonderful. Thank you, thank you, thank you” Moneca, Vancouver, BC

When you sign up for any or all of these classes, you'll receive the free replay so you can listen to the recorded meditations, healing activations, & liquid light transmissions again & again to clear old patterns, automated programs, & genetically inherited stress, struggle, & trauma.

Healing benefits take place outside of time & space & are evergreen. There is no expiration date as the healing energies run continuously for as long as you're willing to receive them.

The class schedule is as follows:

Brain Chatter, Clutter, & Trauma Cleanse 
May 21st @ 12:30pm EDT

Connect With Your Higher Self, Spirit Guides, & Guardians
May 28th @ 12:30pm EDT

Re-Parenting Your Inner Child 
June 4th @ 12:30pm EDT

Inter-Dimensional Soul Retrieval
June 11th @ 12:30 EDT

Reserve your seat today!

These classes are by donation.

The Suggested donation is $25, $35, Or $45 per class.

Join 1 class or all 4! 

Each participant receives the healing activations replay whether you're live on each call or would like to connect with me after the call. 

Listen to the mp3 replay on the go from any phone or computer device or before bedtime to unlock blocks & shift your vibration all night long!!!!

Options for class registration are via paypal or on my website.

To pay with paypal, visit www.paypal.com & send as friend/family to: [masked]
You may also pay on my website at:
http://vandanalighthealing.com/payment/

Once registered, I will send you the call in/skype./webcast details to join me live or receive the recording replay & listen later at your convenience!

Thank You For Your Willingness To Love Yourself Free!!!

Accelerated LIGHT Blessings,
Vandana Atara Aura
Conscious Change Catalyst
Co-Creator Of Accelerated Light Healing

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join me as we start the summer season camping this Memorial Day holiday weekend in one of the most scenic areas of the Northeastern seashore--Cape Cod.


We'll be pitching our tents in Western Cape Cod's Shawme-Crowell State Forest and it's all about the location. The forest's placement makes it an ideal base from which to explore the Cape's many attractions. From here you're minutes away from the quaint seashore town of Sandwich where you can explore its shops and museums. 

Or if outdoor activities are your thing, admission to Scusset Beach is included for campers or you can spend a few hours biking down the banks of the nearby Cape Cod Canal. There are also 10 miles of hiking trails in the forest if walking is your thing. For the truly daring, spend a few hours testing your acrobatic skills--we're just down the road from the Adventure Park in Heritage with it's treetop aerial trails and ziplines.

The Plan ...

We'll arrive Saturday afternoon at the campground office to check in and head to our camp area to set up our tents and other gear. From here we can do as much or as little as we'd like. In the evening we'll cook and have a communal meal over an open fire, and spend the rest of the night doing the usual camping activities -- partaking in adult beverages and stuffing our faces with snacks, playing games, and shooting the breeze.

Sunday we'll get up and make breakfast, then the day is ours to play as we wish. In the evening we'll do more campfire cooking, socializing, and merry making until we nod off.

Monday we awake to enjoy out last meal together, break down our campsites, then head home.


Cost ...

$18.75 per person, click HERE to pay.

Cost is for TWO nights of camping, checking out on Monday. You don't have to stay two nights but that is what you're paying for. Payment is via PayPal -- you don't need a PayPal account and can pay via credit/debit card.

Space is limited so until I receive your payment your RSVP is not confirmed and your attendance is not guaranteed. Once I have confirmation of receipt of your payment I will move you to confirmed RSVP status.

Refunds will be given only if the meetup is cancelled or rescheduled.

Food Plan ...

To keep it simple, everyone is responsible for bringing what they would like to eat and drink. We will be cooking dinner Saturday; breakfast  and dinner Sunday; and breakfast Monday and it will be semi-communal, meaning bring what you would like to eat for yourself but perhaps also enough to share with a few other people. Simple to cook but interesting items are best.


What else do I need to know?

• When you RSVP, please comment if you have camping gear to bring (tent, sleeping bag, etc.).

• I've reserved three campsites. Each site has a fire ring or fireplace with grill for cooking and a picnic table.

• I'd suggest buddy-ing up to save hauling space/equipment costs. It doesn't matter to me if the accommodations are co-ed or gender segregated, everyone can decide what is most comfortable for them.


• Rental gear (tents, sleeping bags, etc.) is available at the Tents and Trails store in downtown NYC, Gear to Go Outfitters in Park Slope, Brooklyn, Eastern Mountain Sports and at several REI stores in the NY/NJ area.

• If you are unsure what to pack, click HERE for a list. You won't need to bring everything on here, but it's a good start. If you are still unsure, please ask.

• The campground has full restroom facilities, hot showers and clean running water.

• Meetup will be cancelled only in the event of a zombie apocalypse or locust swarm of biblical proportions. Possibility of rain or any other precipitation and we still camp.

Directions ...

42 Main Street (Rte. 130) 
Sandwich, MA 
[masked] 


Take Rte. 495 South to the intersection with Rte. 6 East. Follow Rte. 6 East along the Cape Cod Canal to the intersection with Rte. 3 and the Sagamore Bridge Rotary. Follow Rte. 6 East over the Sagamore Bridge to Exit 2 in Sandwich. Follow Rte. 130 into Sandwich and follow the signs 3 miles to the Park entrance on the left.

The park is about 4 hours driving time from Manhattan.


We'll need to carpool to the campground. When you RSVP, please indicate if need a ride. Or if you plan to drive, where you are coming from and how many passengers you can take. We'll then figure out our carpooling options, please be proactive and contact a driver directly rather than just saying where you need a ride from. Gas and tolls will be shared among all the passengers.

Click HERE and HERE for campground maps. Below are the campsite assignments:

SITE 68B, Camp area 2
Kevin
Jane
Lonnie

SITE 67B, Camp area 2
Art
Alex
Aileen
Papa

SITE 66B, Camp area 2
Gwen

Sarah
Amanda

results.description:
THIS MEETUP WILL ONLY TAKE PLACE IF WE GET A MINIMUM OF 6 PEOPLE TO RSVP.  

PLEASE NOTE WHICH LOCATION WE ARE GOING TO THIS TIME.  THIS LOCATION ACTUALLY HAS HALF-PRICED DRINKS DURING THE MARATHONS.

PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.  YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO RE-CONFIRM YOUR RSVP WHEN WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT DAY.  THIS EVENT IS FOR MEMBERS ONLY. IF YOU WANT A FRIEND TO COME, THEY HAVE TO JOIN THE GROUP (with a profile photo!) AND SIGN UP FOR THE EVENT.

YOU MUST BE 21 OR OLDER TO ATTEND THIS EVENT, AND YOU ABSOLUTELY MUST BRING YOUR ID. NO ID, AND YOU CANNOT JOIN THE EVENT.  

So, who wants to spend a Saturday afternoon at a full day, karaoke marathon?!?! Up to seven hours of fun, laughs and songs for only $14!! We will start at 1 pm, and can sing, non-stop until 8 pm.  Or until our voices give out. Whichever comes first.

We are allowed to bring in food (we can even order delivery).  However, you cannot bring in any outside drinks.  Not even water, but they provide free pitchers of water there.  And the drinks are half-priced. (including the non-alcoholic ones)

And don't say "I can't sing", because I can guarantee you that most people who come to these are not winning American Idol any time soon!  But, it's all about having fun and a few laughs!! Trust me, it's a lot of fun, and everyone usually ends up singing along, so you're not totally in the spotlight.  Maybe that's why they have the word "Duet" in the name of the place.

Please, go to www.karaokeduet.com and check out the song selection.  They have the song codes, so write down at least a few and come prepared to start singing right away!! But there are songs that they have in a book of "newly added" songs that aren't yet up on their website.  So if you don't see your favorite, it may still be available!  Past times we were there, the group sang approximately 100 songs in total!!

We will make sure that everyone gets equal opportunity to sing. If needed, we will have one person put all the songs in to space them out for people.

REMEMBER, YOU MUST BRING YOUR ID TO  SHOW THAT YOU ARE OVER 21! NO ID, NO ENTRY.

And remember, if we don't get at least 6 people signed up, the event will be cancelled/postponed.
results.name: Sing Your Heart Out - KARAOKE!!!

We will set up our creative camp in the upstairs ballroom that is full of sunlight and views of the spring flowers and Little Neck Bay.  Spring and Summer are coming and we all want something new to wear or to brighten up our homes.  

If you would like to reserve one of our sewing machines, let me know when you RSVP. 

To get to the Meet-Up tell the guard at the Ft. Totten entrance that you are part of the sewing group at the Castle and he will direct you.  Parking? No problem.

results.description:
Greetings everyone, the weather is getting warmer which means it's "Werewolf In the Park" season! Come one, come all, and tell your friends as well.

On Saturday, May 28th, (our rain date, due to a previous cancellation) we'll be returning to the event that is not unfamiliar to some of our members: Ultimate Werewolf in Fort Tryon Park. Ultimate Werewolf is a social game in which players are randomly assigned to one of two (or possibly more) teams: the villagers or the werewolves. The villagers must deduce who the werewolves are over a series of rounds using various techniques and social intrigue; this must be done before the werewolves are able to eliminate the villagers. For those of you who are unfamiliar with Ultimate Werewolf, check out Tom Vasel's review at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kr1ZyYycUdQ

Ultimate Werewolf is the perfect game to play in an outdoor setting; just bring a folding chair or a picnic blanket and you're ready to go! All you need is the game (which I will supply) and the willingness to communicate with others. We will also be bringing food and beverages in order to picnic throughout the day, so if that aspect of this event interests you, please bring something to pass (though participating in the picnic is not a requirement for this event). Also, if you do not know how to play Ultimate Werewolf, never fear, it is quite simple and several of us will be able to teach it to you within minutes; don't let that hold you back! We'll be meeting in Fort Tryon park, just north of Linden Terrace. Follow this link for a map:

Click here for Fort Tryon Map!

Walking directions version of Map from the (A) Train 190th street station stop. Remember to take the Elevator up!


We will be in the area indicated by the "meeple". Fort Tryon Park's entrance is located on the elevated street level at the 190th street station on the A-train. We hope to see you there! Message me if you need more information. Beginners and experts welcome; even if you're not sure if you want to play, stop by to observe and introduce yourself!
results.name: Werewolf In the Park (2016 Edition) -Rain Date!!!

results.description:
An interactive presentation of how numbers create the universe.


The facilitator,  E. Bernard West serves the Ancient Mystical Order Rosae Crucis (AMORC) and Traditional Martinist Order (TMO) as a lifetime member. During his many years of membership he is known for his expertise in Egyptian, Greek and Roman mythology.  He is a retired Army Officer who currently serves as the TMO Provincial Master in Georgia and  Grand Councilor  for Georgia and Louisiana for AMORC EGL. He also serves various masonic affiliations including Master of a Prince Hall Affiliated Blue Lodge, Patron of an Eastern Star Chapter, a Noble of the Mystic Shrine and Grand Inspector General 33ᵒ United Supreme Council. Bernard has a Master’s of Art in Political Science and a PhD in American Studies and is a published author.
results.name: Discuss a Different View of Numbers (How the Universe Began)

results.description:
Come join us for a special Brunch at a life-sized replica of a luxurious old world train car.  The décor of Le Train Bleu definitely evokes the old-timey sense of opulence and excitement of traveling across Europe by rail, from the vintage train posters to the overhead racks, to the "occupied/vacant" light on the bathroom. It's actually a replica of a specific train-- the dining car from the 1920's-era Calais-Mediterranean Express, nicknamed Le Train Bleu for the color of the sleeper cars.

It was so popular back in the day that it even captured the attention of Agatha Christie; she set her 1928 novel, "The Mystery of the Blue Train", on the express.

Bloomingdale's on 59thhas been a New York institution since 1886, but did you know there's a "secret" restaurant inside the department store that most New Yorkers have never stepped foot in? Tucked away behind the unassuming sixth floor housewares section, Le Train Bleuis a magical little eatery housed inside a life-size replica of a 19th-century French luxury train called the Calais-Mediterranée Express. The one-of-a-kind train car restaurant has been transporting diners to another world complete with Victorian lamps and plush velvet walls for over 30 years now - without ever even leaving the station.

Read more: Le Train Bleu: A secret train car restaurant hidden inside Bloomingdale's | Inhabitant New York City

The restaurant is wider than a train car, but the French music and velvet interiors take you away from the hustle and bustle of the city. For Jack Hruska, Bloomingdale's Executive Vice President of Creative Services, the restaurant has been an "unintentional secret" for years.

Kindly pay the $3.00 Event fee to Paypal which holds your place before you RSVP -this is to maintain the monthly Meet Up Fee, the printing costs,  & group costs, Thank you. If you don't have Paypal, just scroll down to the prompt and pay with a credit or debit card.  Much appreciated.

Prix Fixe Brunch

$28. Includes choice of any Brunch item, fresh coffee, and a Bloody Mary or Mimosa.

Le Train Bleu  4.2Bloomingdale'sAddress: 1000 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10022Phone:<a>(212)[masked]</a>

______________________________________________________________________________

5 Stars -Adorable, good value~  Open Table Diner Since 2010 (New York Area)·Dined on May 1, 2016

This place is adorable, fitted out like a dining car on an old steam train. The service was good, the food was delicious, and the cocktails were well made and potent, especially the Bloody Mary with fresh grated horseradish. This is a great place for lunch or brunch, and a very reasonably priced for a restaurant in the UES. Really enjoyed it.____________________

5 Stars -Rare find! Open Table Diner Since 2015 (Miami)·Dined on April 23, 2016

Located on top of Bloomingdales, it's a bit of a challenge to find, but once you do you're in a different world! Real train car, with a view of the high rises, even with little 1920's lamps on the tables, the ambiance is definitely unique. Quiet, great for dates or just cozy get together where you want to talk and actually hear the other person. The food prices are reasonable and everything was delicious. The service was beyond reproach too: friendly, timely, great recommendations and great follow up at the end of the meal. Thank you! Really added a memorable experience highlight to my nyc trip.______________________________________

5 Stars -Unique Spot...! Rayjc421 (New York Area)·Dined on April 18, 2016

This was a very unexpected treat. The dining car theme was wonderful, something you wouldn't expect in a department store. The food was excellent!!!! We had the crab cake appetizer which was delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant for special occasions._______________________________________________________________________

5 Stars -A gem of a find! Marilynab (New York Area)·Dined on February 27, 2016

Great ambience! The food options were varied and good.___________________________________________________________________________

results.name: Brunch at the "best kept" secret 19th century train car "Le-Train-Bleu"

results.description:
Memorably described by Pauline Kael as "a beautiful pipe dream of a movie," Robert Altman'sMcCabe & Mrs. Miller reimagines the American West as a muddy frontier filled with hustlers, opportunists, and corporate sharks -- a turn-of-the-century model for a 1971 America mired in violence and lies. John McCabe (Warren Beatty) wanders into the turn-of-the-century wilderness village known as Presbyterian Church, with vague plans of parlaying his gambling winnings into establishing a fancy casino-brothel-bathhouse. McCabe's business partner is prostitute Mrs. Miller (Julie Christie), who despite her apparent distaste for McCabe helps him achieve his goal. Once McCabe and Mrs. Miller become successful, the town grows and prospers, incurring the jealousy of a local mining company that wants to buy McCabe out. Filmed on location in Canada, McCabe & Mrs. Miller makes use of such Altman "stock company" performers as Shelley Duvall, René Auberjonois, John Schuck, andKeith Carradine. The seemingly improvised screenplay was based on a novel by Edmund Naughtonand the movie features a soundtrack of songs by Leonard Cohen. McCabe & Mrs. Miller joined such other Altman efforts as M*A*S*H, The Long Goodbye, and Thieves Like Us in radically revising familiar movie genres for the disillusioned Vietnam era.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F2BSHp9oYD0

results.description:
Dear Members,

We will meet at 19th Street on 23rd avenue Astoria Park sidewalk at 2pm.  From there, we’ll walk to a nearby place in the park where our meeting will take place.

Note: Sidewalk waiting time for members to arrive is 15 minutes, maximum. If you miss us, just text or call me at (347) 461-4304. 

FITNESS FOR THE BODY, MIND and SOUL


A Holistic Wellbeing Experience 

Bringing Together What Was Never Meant To Be Apart

Meditation - Exercise – Healthy Eating – Philosophy – Meaningful Connection

“It matters that you make healthy choices every day. It matters that you live your life in the moment. It matters that you love and that you care about becoming the best human being you can be.”


THE PROGRAM  


 PART ONE

·   Be Present - An Inner Moment Experience

10 minute meditation. This is to enhance mindfulness during exercise and conversation.

At the end of the meditation, you will randomly select a piece of paper with a secret phrase or question. This is your mental workout during the exercise session. Later, you will comment about the phrase or question you've received.

PART TWO

· Moving with the Moment.

50 minute Workout. Conditioning and interval training - boot camp style exercise.

You will be going over a circuit routine, a series of bodyweight exercises, from squats to ab work, to resistance band stretch to TRX rows. You will follow your own rhythm, strength and capabilities while I make sure you are motivated and performing the exercises with good form. This routine is tailored to anyone without injuries. 

PART THREE

· Healthy Eating Awareness and Open Discussion of Ethics and “How to Live."

1 hour.

A healthy snack moment: You’re welcome to ask any question about nutrition for weight loss or muscle building.  (snack provided)

A philosophical moment: Each member will read the phrase that was given in the beginning of event and be asked to comment on it. The group will be encouraged to explore and expand on this comment. 

P.S. Philosophical conversation is based on Stoicism, but all kind of reflective topics, ideas and questions are welcome!

PART FOUR

· Stay Present

10 minute meditation. A final reminder to live each and every moment the healthiest way possible.

THE GOAL

Make true connection with the nature of what is important in life:

1- Your physical and mental health.

2- The cultivation of good relationships.

3- The appreciation of beauty in nature and art.

4- The drive and courage to do what is right and healthy for money.

5- Trust the notion that everything happens for a good reason. 

"I believe that LIFE is a compelling gift and that a mysterious CREATOR brought us here to be connected in a meaningful and positive way."  

NOTE: This event is suited for people in the pursuit of holistic wellbeing at all levels of fitness.

*** Payment can made in advance by credit card here on  Meetup or with cash at location.

I will see you soon!

With strength and warmth,

Valeria

www.FITNESSANDPHILOSOPHY.org

</a>

<a href="http://www.VALERIAFITNESS.com">

results.name: Move - Burn Fat - Heal - Connect

As you would imagine this would mean we won't be going to the diner afterward. It'll be a bit of a trip to make it down to Chinatown but we'll do it as a group and we'll have a great time.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>

results.description:
Who is asking these questions ?

You and others who read this.

Ok, Thanks a lot for that!

No problem, it's nice doing empathy.

Is this free or donation based class ?


it's a donation based class.

I kept the group completely free for two years and paid all the organizer dues out of my pocket. Meetup is not really helping me to give free classes or with organizer fees-And it's not small, believe me- 

So the classes will be donation based starting from 2016

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket.Feel free to post a message below and hopefully someone would have an extra mat. 

Should i ask the organizer if he can arrange extra mats for me ?

Seriously ?

Oh, OK.I'm sorry. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.


Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?


It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. Umit will be helping you with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice): 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26108446/
results.how_to_find_us: just get to the corner of 72nd and 5th. Take a close look at the benches on your left handside. We are there !!!

results.description:
La gran final! It's the repeat of the magical Final 2 years ago! Everyone is saying Atletico are favorites and that this time, they will win it, we just have to prove them wrong....again! For this Special day, you want to be surrounded by the most passionate madridistas in NYC! We have secured a very ample locale, that will accommodate up to 700 madridistas, so this is the place to be! Let's do this, A por la Un-Decima!

** 


Please make EVERY effort to RSVP ASAP so that Barleycorn's (located downtown NY by the City Hall) and us can organize the event appropriately. We expect massive attendance and for that reason, we have reserved a very large space that will be decorated ALL Real Madrid! There is no cover fee, all madridistas welcome!

***

INSTRUCCIONES EN ESPAÑOL PARA TURISTAS, MIRAD MAS ABAJO:

 
Game starts at 2:45 pm, but we strongly encourage you and your friends to arrive much, much earlier and enjoy the music, the atmosphere, a nice cold Mahou and the company of hundreds of madridistas! We will have food and drink specials.


Please Read Carefully:

1. All Madridistas are welcome! We are THE place to be if you are a Real Madrid fan in NYC. There is no cover fee. ONLY madridistas please, don't bring any Barsa or Atletico friends, leave them home, this is Real Madrid's home base in NYC!!


2. Official Peña Members (OPM) and up to 2 of their guests will have entrance and placement priority in the downstairs area with RSVP if arriving at least 30 min. before the game. Please bring your membership card with you. There will be an area in the large downstairs floor for OPMs only.

3. Basic Meetup Members, tourists, and occasional visitors will be accommodated in the rest of the downstairs are and upstairs on a first-come, first-serve basis. 

You can purchase our official t-shirts and scarfs at our partner's upper90 truck, that will be located just at the entrance of the bar on game day.


INSTRUCCIONES PARA TURISTAS: 

1. Todos los Madridistas son bienvenidos! Somos el mini-Bernabeu de Manhattan, el mejor sitio para ver la final, rodeado de Madridistas y disfrutanto de una Mahou! La entrada es gratis, todos son bienvenidos, pero dejen a sus amigos del Barsa or del Atletico en casa, por favor.  Esto es la Penia del Real Madrid! Y vengan pronto, no esperen al ultimo minute, se quedaran sin poder entrar.

2. Los miembros oficiales de la Penya que reserven asistencia y hasta dos invitados tienen prioridad de entrada si lleguan con 30 mintos de antelacion. El primer piso esta reservado para los miembros oficiales.. 

3. Turistas, vistantes ocasionales y curiosos serán acomodados en el resto de la planta baja y en el amplio segundo piso del bar en orden de llegada. No se puede reservar mesa. Para este grupo recomendamos que vengan por lo menos 1 o 2 HORAs antes del partido si quieren sentarse en nuestro bar. Cuanto antes lleguen, mejor, no apuren hasta el ultimo minuto, por favor. 


A por la Undecima, Hala Madrid!!!

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play. 

When you sign up for a session, please check the RSVP list in the column at the right. If we already have 3 guitarists, 2 keyboard players, a bassist, and a drummer, then we don't need any more of those instruments. Sign up for another one.

This isn't a group for beginners. Many of the songs we play are harmonically and melodically complex. You should have some proficiency with your instrument, though you may be new to jazz.

We try to provide a place where musicians at different levels can come together, develop their skills as jazz players, and freely explore their creativity. Toward that end, we do not tolerate anyone criticizing another's playing.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a tune that's not in the book, you must bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above. I'll usually let everyone know by Thursday which room we'll be in on Saturday. The rooms cost $72 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.

If you sign up for a jam and can't make it, you need to post a message or call or text me. There may be others who want to take your place.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.

results.description:
Planning on staying in town for the Memorial Day Weekend?

If so, join us in discussing important topics involving the servicemembers and the vets.  Possible discussion topics may include:

• Women now serving in combat roles -- should registering with the Selective Service be required?

• Whether the V.A. should be privatized?

• The Congressional tussle over the funding of the post-9/11 G.I. Bill.

• The notion of "Boots on the Ground" -- time to reconsider this outdated expression?

• "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" -- a look back after its repeal five years ago.

• The recent (re)deployment of the U.S. troops in Iraq and Syria.

 . . . and of course, we'll discuss how these issues will play out during the 2016 Presidential Elections.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

VENUE: we'll meet outdoors at Bryant Park, next to the "Bryant Park Grill" (see photo and map below).
results.name: Memorial Day Weekend Special: Veterans' and Servicemembers' Topics

results.description:
[Cross-posted from NYC Stoics]

"[People], brother Gallio, wish to live happily, but are dull at perceiving exactly what it is that makes life happy...." Seneca starts off "On the Happy Life" by suggesting that most people don't know how to create a happy life for themselves. If this is indeed the case, then what exactly goes into making one?

In this meetup, we will continue our year of Seneca by exploring his answers to this question and more in "On the Happy Life" (De Vita Beata). This text both serves as a fairly good introduction to some aspects of Stoicism while also offering quite a bit to those who are more familiar with Stoicism's basic tenets; both beginners and people more familiar with Stoicism may benefit from this meetup.

To prepare for the meetup, please read the text in full. Also, come prepared with at least one concept or passage you would like to discuss in more detail. Finally, please take note of any practices or concepts that Seneca mentions in this text that would be useful to a modern Stoic. While you are welcome to use any translation you'd like, there is a quite good translation available from Wikisource for free.
results.name: On the Happy Life (De Vita Beata)

results.description:
NAVA = North Atlantic Videogame Aficionados. This is a FREE event bringing gamers together for competition, trading, & chatter.

Previously at NAVA...


- In our last episode we went where no NAVA had gone before; NAVA IN SPACE!


-There were tons of games revolving around space like Astrosmash for the Intellivision, Space War on Vectrex, & 50 different games for the Atari 2600.


-Our tournament was Space Invaders for the SNES & Matt “Nacho” was our champion & took home the Wind Waker print by Alfredo Abbatemarco.


- The arcade challenge was Space Ace & Christopher Roberts won with 323,321 points, & would have walked away with a $20 gift certificate as his prize if he was there to claim it.


- Games & systems traded hands between attendees who brought their own trade boxes.

See it all in our photo gallery section at the store's website & feel free to comment!


http://dpvideogames.com/galleries/

This Month's NAVA: Has anyone seen Bubsy lately? He’s a bright orange bobcat, usually wears a white T-shirt with a red exclamation point. No? How about Bonk? He’s a little short guy with a big head, sports a leopard print loin cloth. Haven’t seen him either huh? Come to think of it, a lot of mascots have gone missing over the years; Earthworm Jim, Boogerman, Aero the Acrobat, all missing. Well you’ll find them at this month’s NAVA; Missing Mascots. All your favorites will be there like Rocket Knight for the Sega Genesis, Joe & Mac for the Super Nintendo, & Bubsy might show up too.

Arcade challenge! Pocky & Rocky is known for being a fun, addictive, & now very expensive Super Nintendo title, it’s actually the sequel to an arcade game in Japan known as KiKi KaiKai. The game plays just like the SNES game; it’s a scrolling shooter where you play as a little girl & work your way up through the map shooting enemies along the way & rack up the highest score. Be the best at the game on this one day by logging the highest score on our arcade cabinet by 9pm & win a nifty $20 gift certificate & possibly get your name added to the "House Champion" tournament plaque on the Wall of Fame just above the arcade section of the store. Arcade challenge games are set to FREE PLAY all day, but please remember to let everyone get a shot. If you get the high score, move on, & no hogging the cabinet! Also if you have won last month’s NAVA arcade challenge you are no eligible to win this month’s challenge.

Tournament! We will be playing one of the games from the short lived ClayFighter series. Specifically ClayFighter: Tournament Edition for the SNES. Sign-ups begin at 3pm, the tournament starts around 6pm & its first-come, first-served in this FREE-to-join tournament.

Keep in mind from now on trade boxes cannot take up more than 5 square feet. To clarify 5 square feet is an area that is 5 feet by 1 foot, 2 & a half feet by 2 feet, or any other way that takes up that much space. Trade boxes can be more than one box; they just need to fit in that much space. We will make exceptions for those who bring art or homebrews. If you bring something you made yourself we will not prevent you from putting out both that & an appropriately sized trade box. We will also make exceptions if you have items that themselves are large, like boxed systems or special editions to certain games. If you brought a CIB Steel Battalion we’re not going to make you pack up half of your other items in your trade box. We will ask you to pack up some things if you bring a lot of large items. We cannot have such large trade boxes anymore because it’s a fire hazard. 

Remember to get your trade boxes in order so we can all buy, sell & trade together. Wear your NAVA or Digital Press t-shirt for the maximum discount on store purchases. Also, bring your Nintendo 3DS to share street passes... it's NAVA time!

RSVP (optional): 

http://www.facebook.com/digitpress?sk=events


When: Saturday, May 28th, 3pm to midnight.


Where: Digital Press Videogames: 

http://tinyurl.com/7nobzcr


What happens: Gaming, trading, tournaments, big prizes! Extra game stations are set up around the store. Attendance is FREE. Half price for kids!


What can I bring?: It's nice to share. Snacks, soda & beer are always appreciated. Cakes have been very popular as well.

results.description:
Final Update:

We are going to Aumm Aumm

This place is really great; Judy, Jackie and I have been there. They are a very popular wine bar/mostly specialty pizza restaurant (with other Italian dishes besides pizza). They have a huge wine list, homemade sangria, the freshest made food. brick oven and excellent service. Its a bit noisy, but its hard to explain why, but the ambience, the food, bar and service just make you want to sit there for hours.

IMPORTANT!!! They do NOT take reservations, but they just told me they will accomodate 11 or 12 ONLY if everyone gets there on time. At least one of us needs to be there first and have them set up a table. Its worth it.

If you RSVP Yes and do not show up, you are gone, baby gone.

Can't wait!

🎩🐰🐭🐛🌹🍰🍮🎂🍽🎟🎬💜😍😺👸👑

results.description:
Last summer, a group of Black professionals launched the Secret Picnic Party in New York City. They invited their friends to save the date, who invited their friends and so on and so forth. 24 hours before the date, the hosts emailed everyone the secret location. Hundreds of Blacks professionals gathered in parks to lay out in the sun, meet new people, and play games. This year, that same group is back again for the Secret Picnic Party.


This will be a great occasion for us to get together to chill out and get to know one another.

Please bring something for your self such as a sandwich or salad and something for the group such as:

Snacks: Plantin chips, Potato chips, etc.
Desert: Cookies, Cupcakes, etc.
Alcohol:  Wine, Wine Coolers, etc.
Games: Uno, Taboo, etc.

I'd suggest everyone bring a bottle of water as well since you may start to feel dehydrated sitting in the sun.

In your RSVP's please mention what you will bring.

RSVP at this link once you've RSVP'd on our Meetup event page. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/secret-picnic-party-sppnyc-tickets-25232292466

Please keep a lookout on your emails 24 hours before the event to find out the park location.

See you there!
results.name: Can you Keep a Secret?...The Secret Picnic Party

results.description:
I remember we talked

about how poetry

can bend and expand

language making new

meaning of words

and exciting the mind

and imagination, but so

what that's not the point

of poetry, you said, it has to

give the reader something

to feel and a reason to come

back again and again,

like the city - no one cares

if they build a new skyscraper

with an odd modern shape,

it has to make you think 

of a lover and wash across 

your chest softly, that's what 

poetry is for, not some academic 

exercise but a blatant assault 

on what it feels like to live 

at the edge of certainty,

then even if just for a moment 

leap off and become engulfed 

within the deep abyss that is 

all your painful past and bliss-

filled future. That's crap you said,

poetry is not therapy, it's not

here to heal or to delight 

or to just give us pleasure.

If you want to feel good

have sex, poetry is a call

to move beyond what's 

directly in front of us,

it's the first flick of a 

candle burning gently

in a dark dark room 

giving us just enough 

light to believe in something

larger than this world ---

Stop stop I said, you're saying

poetry is a deeply spiritual

process, something to give

us faith something to help

us hold on to our faith, yet

I've known agnostics and 

atheists who write damn

good poems. Poetry is not

about God, so don't get me

started you said, on what a 

poem can do for a broken

heart. If you read the right

one aloud often enough

blood rushes through you 

faster and faster and you 

grow bolder and stronger. 

Poetry propels you toward 

everything that you can be. 

It's physical like boxing or 

weight-lifting or long-distance 

running: once a poem gets 

inside you you're no longer 

who you were before, so sure 

I said, poetry is physical:

how it gets into your lungs 

and how its rhythm holds 

you together, but it's not

music, poems are not diddies

or anthems to be sung out

before swelling crowds.

You don't read a poem 


on stage at Woodstock 

you play the fucking

guitar and drums. Poetry 

is softer yet stronger than 

music, it's something wholly 

other than what we've been

told. Then I remember a bolt

of lightning struck out just 

above the walk-up building 

across the way near Fourteenth 

Street, and a few moments later 

you said again, so what's the point 

of poetry, and I really paused for 

a long while and just sat across 

the table from you, and looked out 

the window at the last Saturday

of October, and God the rain

was falling and you were beautiful

and holding your small yellow mug 

of English Breakfast tea and I could 

smell the rain and feel the thunder 

that rolled across Sixth Avenue

and you asked me again, what

do you think is the point of poetry,

and I remember wanting to give

you a specific and perfect answer

yet the longer your question floated 

between us the more certain I was:

that maybe we were living within 

a poem and maybe the poem had 

just passed over us and might come

back a few hours or days later, yet 

either way somehow I knew that at least 

in that moment we both had our answer.

-- -- --

Come to Tea and Poetry next Saturday, May 28th, 2016 at 4pm. 68 Jay Street. Bring a few poems or prose pieces on poetry ––– pieces of your own, or works by other poets and writers. We'll skip the writing. We'll drink tea and read. We'll read and drink tea.

Look forward to it. 

Best,

Isaac

results.description:
Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com
results.name: Shabbat Meditation

What you can do at fire me up!

PAINT YOUR OWN POTTERY!
Pick a piece of pottery from our wide selection of mugs, plates, frames, figurines and more. Design, decorate, doodle or ask us about special techniques! In 7 days, pieces will be glazed, fired and ready for pick up!

GLASS FUSING!
Glass fusing is a fun way to make your own unique jewelry, nightlights, platters and more using bits and pieces of glass. Create your own abstract design, or use our templates to help you get started.

*There is a 12 person minimum so please only RSVP if you are able to attend*

General rules of the game:

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Sliding is allowed but be careful.  Be mindful of who is covering the base if you choose to slide.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

Unless someone wants to play C the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

Unless someone wants to pitch the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

If 24 people sign up, the defense will be rotated so that each team member plays 4 innings in the field for each 1 they sit.

Fee structure:

First game free.

$5 per person per game

$25 for the season.

Please arrive promptly by 4pm.

I'll email/post in the event of inclement weather potentially impacting the game.  Alternatively you can call the hotline at[masked] x111

"Since the dawn of civilization, he was worshiped as a god. Apocalypse, the first and most powerful individual ever to be born a mutant, amassed the powers of many others of his kind, becoming immortal and invincible. Upon awakening after thousands of years, he is disillusioned with the world as he finds it and recruits a team of four Horsemen, including a disheartened Magneto, to cleanse mankind and create a new world order, over which he will reign. As the fate of the Earth hangs in the balance, Mystique, with the help of Professor X, must lead a team of young X-Men to stop their greatest nemesis and save mankind from complete destruction.”


We'll be going to the 5:05 3D showing of X-Men: Apocalypse at the AMC Loews Kips Bay 15. Please meet up in the lobby at 4:10 PM, and we'll head upstairs to get in line for the theater at 4:20.

Fandango

After the movie, we'll be heading over to the The Mad Hatter for food and drinks. If you already have plans to see the movie and just want to meet up afterwards, I'm assuming that we'll arrive around 8:10 PM.


Thanks, and hope to see you all then!
