results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 5:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 5:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Saturday Pick-up Parade grounds 5:00 PM

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Let's get together and play some board games. My husband and I have over a dozen board games. Including Betrayal, Family Business, Arabian Nights, Pathfinder, The Panda Game, Pandemic and many more. But feel free to bring your own! 

We will be hosting this at our place, and we will be providing some light refreshments and some chips. Please feel free to bring snacks. We are open to ordering pizza/tacos/whatever for those who want to chip in. 

We do own cats, if you are allergic/not cat friendly please let me know before the day of the meetup and I will do my best to accommodate you (by which I mean they will be placed in the bedroom away from everyone).

Let the games begin!
results.name: Let's meetup and play some board games!

results.name: Meditation Class

results.description:
Join us, as we explore the basis of Meditation & Self-knowledge, Mysticism, Kabbalah, Esotericism, Astral Projection, Sacred Sexuality, Alchemy, and the mysteries of The human Consciousness. 

Topics to study:


- Gnosis & The awakening of the Consciousness: Mindfulness, Self-observation, The term "Gnosis" & it's foundations; Science, Philosophy, Art and Mysticism. 


- Karma: The Law of Karma and Dharma. The transmigration of the soul & reincarnation.


- Kabbalah & Alchemy: The tree of life, The path of self-realization, The creation of the inner "Merkabah."

- The Astral World: Astral travels, lucid dreams, Dream Yoga. 

- Sacred sexuality: Tantra, the kundalini, & sexual transmutation. 

- The Science of Meditation.

*** Guided Meditation for beginners and intermediate levels after every lecture***

"The Gnostic teachings are based on the communion between science, art, philosophy and mysticism; they seek to rescue the highest values of the human being in order to be able to comprehend that life is empty without the pursuit of transcendence and the self-realization of the Being." Samael Aun Weor
results.name: Introduction to Gnosis

results.description:
Let’s get together and support the premiere screening of BTFC member Michael Paul’s horror film “Shankman’s Deli.” Michael served as a producer on the film, and after a four year journey is proud to be able to bring it to the public.

More about the film synopsis:

When a group of college grads open a butcher shop in a trendy neighborhood, they commit an unspeakable act that puts them under the thumb of their increasingly unbalanced friend. As the cover-ups spins out of control, you'll be surprised what ends up on the menu.


Message from the filmmakers:


4 years today we were deep in the midst of trying to raise $40,000 on KickStarter to shoot our movie and now in a little less than a month we will have our premier!!!


It has been a long journey but one well worth it. Hopefully after the premier we will be able to make it available to the public for all to enjoy. Thanks for believing in us.

 https://www.facebook.com/Shankmans-Deli-179582152120856/?fref=ts
results.name: Premiere screening of BTFC member Michael Paul’s horror film “Shankman’s Deli”

group.name: The Black TV and Film Collective

results.description:
This meetup is a place for people to come together and play lighter style, party, and social games.  Think games like Settlers of Catan, Ticket to Ride, Betrayal at House on the Hill, The Resistance, or Superfight.  The focus is more on having a good time and meeting new people than playing the most competitive games that exist.  

There is a $5 per person cover charge at this venue, but that includes ample table space, and access to a selection of over 160 games.

Join us for our Sunset Single Mingle
6 PM- 8 PM with live music afterwards


Our past Long Island Single Mingle events have had  had a great turnout.  Join other fun singles looking to eat, drink, mingle and welcome in the great weather.  There will be a buffet, prize give-a-way's, and contests/icebreakers to get you in the spirit of mingling and meeting other attendees.  We will have our own outside private space exclusively for our members.  Arrive early and your name will be entered in our various prize drawings! This is positively a mingle  you won't want to miss !

Enjoy:

* A Fantastic Sunset Single Mingle!
*Private space for our group
*Dedicated Meetup organizer to introduce you around* *Mingling with other fun Singles! 
* BBQ (Penne Alavodka, Salad, Sausage/Peppers, Eggplant etc)

*Icebreaker Games-  
* Raffles with various prize drawings!
*Live Music to follow the mingle


So show up early and stay late, you never know who you might meet! 

* Dress Code:  Casual but neat

PRICE

 $17- $25 depending on when you register Prepayment required HERE

results.description:
What is qabalah? What is the Tree of Life? What techniques can I learn from qabalah to help me in my day-to-day life?

Join us as we finish our three-part discussion on an essay from Jim Eshelman's book "Pearls Of Wisdom" on "The 32 Paths Of Wisdom", a key text of qabalah. Concluding from our last two meetings, we'll go in-depth on the correspondences and images embodied in the Tree of Life. We'll also discuss basic techniques for using these symbols in meditation and personal ritual.


This lecture is part of a series of talks drawn from the book "Pearls Of Wisdom". It will be possible to participate in the discussion without having read the book, and there will be copies of the book available for purchase at the discussion.  ($30.00)

We ask $8.00 donation for room rental.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the #1 subway to 28th street. We are on the 3rd floor in the room in the back.
results.name: Introduction to Hermetic Qabalah, Part III

results.description:
We succeeded in getting the reserved seats for the 7PM 4DX showing of XMEN: Apocalypse for Saturday on its opening weekend. THERE ARE STILL SEATS LEFT!!! But you have to hurry, they will probably all be sold out before the end of the day.  You can order your tickets through Fandango, but you should hurry.

We bought a row of tickets at our discounted rate. Most have already been claimed, but let us know if you are interested because tickets may become available from our bunch as the date approaches.

This is the long awaited next installment of the Xmen saga, viewed in 4DX!! The ultimate movie experience. Because of the reserved seating, we can relax and meet only a half hour before the show starts. Get our snacks, and socialize without worrying about getting bad seats.
results.name: X-Men: Apocalypse 4DX

results.description:
Meet to see "Money Monster". Meet in by the ticket machines in the lobby 6:15 to 6:30 then head into the theater to get seats.  After the movie meet in lobby then go over to a nearby restaurant.
Joining with a friends Meetup group.

Synopsis:
"Lee Gates is a TV personality whose insider tips have made him the money guru of Wall Street. When Kyle loses all of his family's money on a bad tip, he holds Lee and his entire show hostage on air threatening to kill Lee if he does not get the stock up 24 and a half points before the bell. Ratings soar as the entire country tunes in to this media frenzy to find out just how much a man's life is worth. Meanwhile, the hostage situation sheds light on a possible scandal involving the company in question. With elements of Dog Day Afternoon and Network, MONEY MONSTER is a very timely piece in these economic times."
Running Time: 1 hr 35 min
Genre: Suspense
Director: Jodie Foster
Cast: George Clooney, Jack O'Connell, Julia Roberts
results.name: See "Money Monster" 6:50PM show & local restaurant

results.description:
Cafe Improv http://www.cafeimprov.com/

See engaging live performances of music, poetry, and comedy in the Solley Theater at the Arts Council of Princeton, centrally located at 102 Witherspoon Street in downtown Princeton, NJ http://cafeimprov.weebly.com/directions.html

Each month (usually on the 4th Saturday), the show runs from 6:45 to approx. 10:00 P.M., is recorded and then is broadcast throughout the following month on Princeton Community Television.

Admission: $2.00 ($1.00 for ACP members)

Note: I am on the staff for these shows so if you want to find me, just ask any of the staff and introduce yourself to me. I usually operate one of the TV cameras.

THIS MEETUP REPEATS ON THE 4th SATURDAY OF EACH MONTH unless announced otherwise
results.name: Cafe Improv variety show

results.description:
Light Of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that includes meditation, creative activities, and more. It is as still and quiet, as it is joyous and fun. We aim to create a loving and supportive community for all who participate - before, during, and after the ceremony.  

To honor the privacy of our participants. No further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation. Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list. 

Thank you!
results.name: Light Of Iris Ceremony

results.description: All right, Mangiaphiles ... this is the moment you've been waiting for--well, many of us, at least. Dos Caminos is an exuberant Mexican restaurant with a snazzy outpost on Park Avenue South that offers crispy, crunchy grasshoppers for your guacamole, as well as a host of other savory dishes, plus margs, of course. Prices are relatively reasonable; entrees top out at about $28, with most in the low-$20s. But the real treat here, in my opinion, is the opportunity to munch on edible insects, which are often quite delicious. Let me know if you are interested in going by April 30. Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the restaurant. Bring your appetites!
results.name: Grasshoppers and Mexican fare at Dos Caminos!

Warm weather is finally here and we have Fashions on the waters. 2 amazing shows on a yacht. 3 floors and 3 hours . Are you ready? 

Tickets now $25 then the remaining few for $35. This cruise is almost sold out . NOTHING WILL BE SOLD AT THE PIER,

On this cruise you will meet Lady Liberty, pass by Governors Island, Ellis Island, go under Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg Bridges. Cruise along New York's famous night time skyline for 3 full hours. Come alone or invite all of your friends. 

Entertainment: We will have 2 fashion shows. GiGI Culture with anamazing Bikini show and Vanyo Fashion with her Spring dress collection. Colors of Nation. We will also have a DJ on board playing everything you love.

Food: Once on board you may also purchase dinner buffet for just only $12. (Meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, pasta, rice, salads. An incredible meal. Drinks run about $5-$8. 

WHERE THE BOAT IS LOCATED: Pier 40 is located on West Houston street and West side Hway. On the Hudson River. We board 7pm, leave at 8:00pm, return at 11:00pm from pier 40. DO NOT BE LATE!!

Pier 40 By Subway: 1 or 9 train to Christopher Street OR Houston Street. Walk West bound towards the Henry Hudson River directly to pier 40. The walk is just a few blocks. Remember to walk towards once on Houston Street or just follow the crowd of people walking in that direction. 353 West St, New York, NY 10014

This is going to be a lot of fun, please join us. As always nothing will be sold at the boat. This will sell out quick. THIS YACHT HAS 3 FLOORS, 2 OUTDOORS DECKS AND 145 FEET LONG!

Dress Code: No tank tops. t-shirts and jeans are fine, however no flip flops. Sandals are ok. Bring cameras, but no tripods.NO LARGE BAGS PERMITTED ON BOARD. MUST BE OVER 21 with ID. This is a rain or shine event. No refunds. Fully enclosed boat. Promise you will have a great time on this yacht.

Vega Productions and Manhattan Wine Group

venue.name: Cha Cha's In Bocca Al Lupo Cafe

results.description:
On May 28th, 2011, 20 or so bronies met up for the first time to celebrate our mutual love of candy colored equines, and it became the birth of BroniesNYC. Whether this is your first meet, or you've been here since the beginning, let's go back and celebrate our humble birth.

Yes, Cha Cha's doesn't offer the best food, but we lost our reservations at our original meeting place, and had to find a place that could house 20 or so people at a moment's notice, and Cha Cha's was empty. We can safely say the pizza, spaghetti, and various desserts are good.

http://www.littleitalynyc.com/chacha/

DIRECTIONS: Take the J or 6 train to Canal St, and walk 3 blocks south to Mulberry St, or take the B or D train to Grand St, follow Chrystie St southwest 2 blocks until Canal St, and walk 4 blocks north to Mulberry St.
results.name: Let's Celebrate the 5th Anniversary Where BroniesNYC Started

venue.name: MakerBar

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Give us a call at 1-855-MAKERBAR(625-3722) And we'll help you find the way!

results.description:
The second working brewery in Bergen County (the first is Brix City in Little Ferry), The Alementary in Hackensack, is now officially operational after a grand opening on April 16. In process for over a year, the brewery is a result of some new ordinances passed in the town. Owners Blake Crawford and Michael Roosevelt currently have eight beers available and have detailed their work last month in an interview with NJ.com. http://www.nj.com/bergen/index.ssf/2016/03/hackensack_brewery_starts_production_eyes_april_op.html

The Alementary — Hackensack’s first microbrewery. Our mission is simple: Create approachable and uncomplicated world-class beers in a brewery experience that gives our friends and neighbors a brewery that they are proud to call their own.
http://www.alementary.com/

4oz samples are $2 each, flights of four are $8
Prices are pint/32oz Growler/64oz Growler

58 Voorhis Lane
Hackensack, NJ 07601
[masked]
Grand Opening April 16! Hours thereafter:
Thursday: 5pm - 8pm
Friday: 5pm - 8pm
Saturday: Noon - 10pm
Sunday: Noon - 6pm

When driving down Johnson Ave, look for the sign for Hackensack Glass - we're right next door!

results.description:
The caller's platform will be shared by Quena Crain and Paul Ross whohave prepared a lively program of contras accompanied by Jonah and Friends!

Jonah and Friends are: 

Jonah Sidman - fiddle 

Audrey Knuth - fiddle 

Michael Friedman - piano

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance w/ Quena Crain, Paul Ross, Jonah, and Friends! EVERYBODY CONTRA!

results.description:
Yaar is not a pirate restaurant, sorry, but you're welcome to wear your eye-patch. This restaurant opened a few months ago by the owners of Seva, the popular Indian restaurant near 30th Avenue. But there are a few differences. It is an Indian restaurant, but the bigger kitchen allows the chefs to prepare a more diverse menu. Also, the restaurant is BYOB!!!


If you are bringing a beverage to share, please post in the comments. If you are having someone else's wine, it's always good form to offer a few bucks per glass... and if you're bringing wine, maybe don't splurge on the Chateau Lafite-Rotschild and expect to get back the $400 per glass cost... k, thanks.

Here's a look at their menu- https://www.grubhub.com/restaurant/yaar-indian-restaurant-2255-31st-st-astoria/316352

All positive reviews so far- http://www.yelp.com/biz/yaar-indian-restaurant-astoria


A few reminders: 

• If your plans change for the evening, please update your RSVP with enough lead time for me to change our reservation.

• If you can, please bring cash, because it makes it easier paying the bill. I will ask, but most restaurants won't give out individual checks.

• Please show up on time. We're going to order food at 7:45pm.

• If you bring a guest, please inform them not to order meat. They are definitely welcome, but our members are vegetarian/vegan and some might feel uncomfortable with meat at the table.
results.name: Dinner: Yaar Indian Restaurant

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Have you been to the Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT) Museum?  They have some great FREE exhibits such as "The Women of Harper’s Bazaar, 1936–1958," which just closed.  However, if you love iconic fashion you can also view the exhibit online for free

http://www.fitnyc.edu/museum/exhibitions/women-harpers-bazaar.php

The Women of Harper’s Bazaar, 1936–1958 focuses on a pivotal time in the history of Harper's Bazaar magazine. The exhibition explores the dynamic collaboration among Harper’s Bazaar editor-in-chief Carmel Snow, fashion editor Diana Vreeland, and photographer Louise Dahl-Wolfe, who reinvigorated Harper’s Bazaar by combining their individual talents.  Drawing from The Museum at FIT’s extensive collection of Louise Dahl-Wolfe’s color photographs—donated by the photographer herself—the exhibition highlights original photographs shown alongside nine garments by Christian Dior, Charles James, Mainbocher, Claire McCardell, and Carolyn Schnurer that exemplify the vast array of captivating styles featured in Harper’s Bazaar.

Exhibition Web Site:

http://exhibitions.fitnyc.edu/women-of-harpers-bazaar/#grid-page

Exhibition PDF Brochure:

http://exhibitions.fitnyc.edu/women-of-harpers-bazaar/wp-content/uploads/sites/21/2016/02/Women_of_Harpers_Bazaar_1936_1958_brochure.pdf

Gallery Guide:

http://exhibitions.fitnyc.edu/women-of-harpers-bazaar/wp-content/uploads/sites/21/2016/03/Gallery_Guide_Women_of_Harpers_Bazaar_1936-1958.pdf

Other Upcoming FIT Exhibitions:

http://www.fitnyc.edu/museum/exhibitions/
results.name: FYI Online Exhibition: The Women of Harper’s Bazaar, 1936–1958 (FIT Museum)

group.name: New York History & Culture: Food, Museums & Walking Tours

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Lexington's Lounge at The Cort Hotel is a classy, sophisticated and upscale lounge without the attitude!  It is one of our favorite gathering spots in the city! Please join us for this special night out will get to meet other members and friends  in a comfortable and casual atmosphere.  We'll have staff on hand to welcome you and live DJ music played at conversational levels beginning at 9pm.

Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 8pm

-Our staff will be at the check in table ready to greet you and introduce you to others at the party.

-We'll have a few fun games for you to participate in between 8:30-9:30pm that will get you up and around meeting even more people in the group.

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Live DJ plays chill out retro lounge music from 9pm-1am

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending show up on their own.

Dress code: keep it neat.  Please no sneakers or t-shirts

Is there food available?  Yes, they have an awesome small plates menu.

How long does it last? Usually till 1am

How many people do you expect?  We would normally get about 100 for a night like this.  Mostly 20's-40's and a good mix of men and women.
results.name: Saturday Night Cocktails & Conversations at Lexington's Lounge: FREE Admission!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 3 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game.

I am not reserving 2 spots per game for any new players who have not played with us yet.

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Live DJ plays chill out retro lounge music from 9pm-1am

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending show up on their own.

Dress code: keep it neat.  Please no sneakers or t-shirts

Is there food available?  Yes, they have an awesome small plates menu.

How long does it last? Usually till 1am

How many people do you expect?  We would normally get about 100 for a night like this.  Mostly 20's-40's and a good mix of men and women.
results.name: Saturday Night Cocktails & Conversations at Lexington's Lounge: FREE Admission!

results.description:
HarlemGo & Forch of Nature Music Group proudly presents: "Shed Saturday" - A Live Music Showcase Featuring The Shining Stars of The Shed Open Jam.

The Shed is a bi-monthly (every other Wednesday) open mic jam session catering to New York City's hottest Hip Hop, Soul and Jazz musicians. This Shed Saturday showcase is NOT an open mic - but a showcase that will feature some of the best artists that have appeared at the open mic! It is FREE to attend the showcase and afterparty, however be sure to arrive to the venue WELL before 10PM to avoid a cover charge at the door! Early arrival (between 8:00-8:30pm) is suggested for best available seats.

This month's show features performances by:
Anu-Sun • Aziza & the Cure • MelodiusFly • & Riki Stevens


To learn more about The Shed, visit them on Instagram: www.instagram.com/theshedopenjam

Our Meetup


Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana at 8:00pm to hold seats for group members attending. Showtime is anticipated to start around 8:30pm and goes to 10pm, followed by an DJ/dance afterparty. Free free to invite your friends and enjoy Memorial Saturday Night with us!  As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to call or text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs at the tables along the wall (by the restroom)
results.name: The Shed Saturday Night - Live Music Showcase & Afterparty @ Silvana - FREE!

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
We have a full field permit at 9:00 pm at Pier 40 through June 18, 2016. We are looking to grow and develop the sport, so we need players, and bring friends! If we can build this to a sustaining level we'll extend it into the summer and fall. Show off your skills or learn some new ones, and have a great run!!


We are planning a full field game so we need at least enough people to field two teams.  D-poles are welcome and if you know any goalies bring them along. Try to arrive 15 minutes early so we can go live at 9:00 PM!!!  See you Saturday!

Presents

L E X I C O N

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

Start: [masked], [masked]) Valley Way Trail head, Randolph, NH 03593
End: [masked], [masked]) Crawford Notch Visitor Center, US 302, NH

Presidential Traverse (North to South)

Let's do one of the most beautiful and challenging hikes in New Hampshire. Detailed info about this traverse can be found here.

For group safety and success, all participants are required to fill-up this questionnaire, and send at the earliest to "wasif DOT sid @ gmail.com". Everyone would be on waiting list until I receive a completed form.

Details such as meeting place, food options, hiking route, equipment, bailout, car-shuttle etc would be emailed to all in mid-May. Lodging options would be posted here soon.

Meanwhile, if you've a confirmed RSVP and don't want to wait, hotels and campgrounds near Gorham would be good choices.
------------------------------------

Liability Waiver:
Hiking in front/backcountry is an inherently dangerous activity and can cause serious bodily injury or even death. This is a volunteer-run activity and organizers are in no way responsible for any physical, mental injury or
property damage/loss thereof. By joining this activity, you accept that you've read and understood the description of this hike, including this waiver, and that you've done research about the possible risks involved, and would not fault the organizers for any omissions/errors in the description therein. You also understand that you're solely responsible for your own safety and well-being.

Also, please LEAVE NO TRACE.
results.name: Presidential Range Traverse (20 miles, 9000' gain)

results.description:
Yes, it is that time of the year again to have another Model Shoot. This time it will be on Titan. It will be 48 hours long, Earth time.

Raziya Vonda contacted me and heard about our talented photographers and wanted to do a model shoot. She is working on her portfolio, for Intergalactic Modeling. Raziya also said that she will have a place for us to stay and meals will be catered again.

Titan is the largest moon of Saturn. It is the only natural satellite known to have a dense atmosphere, and the only object other than Earth where clear evidence of stable bodies of surface liquid has been found. Raziya knows all the best locations so we can get a variety of backgrounds in our shots. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titan_(moon)

We will have 5 models this time:
Aapeli Uffe - Male
Iisakki Xerxes - Male
Qiang Zeki - Male
Jacobina Jennigje - Female
Raziya Vonda - Female
Ulloriaq Ogechukwukama - Male/Female
For us humans, this is how we would gender type them.

I have secured a shuttle for this journey, so you won't have to worry about flying out yourselves. You can relax and enjoy the ride or just sleep. Get your Intergalactic passports ready. Make sure they are current.
results.name: Model Shoot on Titan

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans, 


      With the first race of the 2016 European season behind us, up next is the Monaco Grand Prix; the most glamorous, thrilling and unlike any other race on the calendar. Tucked away on the picturesque Cote d’Azur, the Principality’s tortuous, barrier-lined streets provide some of the greatest challenges on the F1 calendar; it’s the race that every driver wants to win.

Championship Standing: Nico Rosberg still leads the Drivers championship with 100 points followed by Kimi Raikkonen with 61 points. Lewis Hamilton drops to third with 57 points after his DNF in Spain. On the constructor front, Mercedes is still ahead with 157 points, followed by Ferrari and Red Bull with 109 and 94 points respectively. 

The Track: The 3.34 km Monaco street circuit, shortest on the calendar, is unique in many aspects: (almost) non-existent run-off areas, slowest average speed of the year (with a race distance of about 260.3 km), extremely bumpy and narrow. While the teams bring the highest possible level of downforce, mechanical grip and drivability are what make the difference for a quick lap. Given that overtaking is almost impossible, it goes without saying that the qualifying session is the most important of the year for a good result in the race. Rain or a safety car would have a large impact on the race result.

Tire allocation: Pirelli will bring for the first time the Ultrasoft (purple) in addition to the Supersoft (red) and Soft (yellow) compounds.


Talking points: Can Nico Rosberg and Lewis Hamilton keep it on the track and have Mercedes return to its winning ways? Can Ferrari sort out their sub-par qualifying and get their first win of the season? Will Red Bull with the help of their phenom Max Verstappen pull off another improbable win? 

Race will start at 08:00 AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 07:30 AM EDT. It's going to be another exciting race. 


We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2016 Monaco Grand Prix

Our intermediate level road ride is great for a wide range of ability levels from novice to expert. 

This is a fun, no-drop ride averaging between 15-17 mph over varying terrain. Total ride time will be approximately 2.5 hours. Distance will be between 30-40 miles with[masked] feet of elevation, depending on the chosen route.

Group ride experience is recommended, but not required.

Ride departs at 8am sharp, so please arrive 15-20 minutes early to prepare your equipment. Riders should bring sufficient nutrition and flat repair supplies (tube, pump/CO2, tire levers).

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP opens on Friday at 8:30am and closes at 9pm on Saturday evening.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. 

- Rmbr, it's a early morning game. Therefore, if you can't make it, change your RSVP well BEFORE Saturday 9pm to give enough notice for anyone on the waitlist. Changing your RSVP after 9pm will also mean a 2 weeks ban.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

Absolutely no exceptions to these rules.


PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

http://1877scubausa.com/images/pop

Check out the Pay One Price Option

Pay One Price is a new concept in SCUBA Certification. The student signs up, Pays One Price for Education, Equipment Use and Certification.

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Using Dive Computers; To help familiarize you with how they work go to: Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.
results.how_to_find_us: Use rear entrance
results.name: New Class Starts Pay One Price

results.description:
Book to discuss: Good to Great : Why Some Companies Make the Leap...And Others Don't   by Jim Collins

Below is from Wikipedia:

Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't is a management book by James C. Collins that aims to describe how companies transition from being average companies to great companies and how companies can fail to make the transition. The book was published on October 16, 2001 by William Collins. "Greatness" is defined as financial performance several multiples better than the market average over a sustained period. Collins finds the main factor for achieving the transition to be a narrow focusing of the company’s resources on their field of competence.

The book was a bestseller, selling four million copies and going far beyond the traditional audience of business book.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details:
9:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be several pace groups, depending on who attends. Typically we have 8-minute, 9-minute, and 10-minute-per-mile groups. Please let your leaders know which group you'll be running in!

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

results.description:
ASMP-NJ’s Photo Field Trip to The High Line - Sunday, May 29th, 9:00am to 12:00pm. Rain date - Monday, May 30th.

A free event open to anyone interested in photography or New York City’s High Line park.

New York City’s newest and only elevated park space - 35 feet above the streets of Manhattan. Running from Gansevoort St. to 34th St., the High Line offers unique views of Manhattan’s skyline, the Hudson River and New Jersey - an opportunity for some great cityscape, architectural and street photography. Park history and general information at: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Line_(New_York_City)

We will be meeting at the 34th St. entrance to the park, between 11th and 12th Avenues (for GPS use 674 W. 34th St, 10001). We will start promptly at 9:00am, so please be on time. If you happen to be running late, just phone Kelly at[masked] and she’ll let you know where you can find us.

Mass transit to the High Line from New Jersey:
NY Waterways Ferry to Manhattan Midtown 39th St. Terminal, http://www.nywaterway.com/FromManhattanMidtownW39th.aspx

The PATH to 33 St. Station at 6th Ave, http://www.panynj.gov/path

NJTransit to Penn Station at 33 St. & 8th Ave., http://www.njtransit.com/sf/sf_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=TrainTo

Driving:
Parking in the area is difficult. The closest garage is Avalon West Chelsea Garage at 585 W. 29th St. NYC 10001. Discounted parking and other garage locations can be found at http://www.parkwhiz.com/high-line-parking

For further information, contact Kelly at [masked].

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Join us for this, the fifth in the series to hike the entire September 11th National Memorial Trail! This time, the hike will be entirely on the Lenape Trail except for a side trip near the end where we turn off and do some Morris Canal to get to the parking lot.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t1.0-9/249454_10150203570351777_759949_n.jpg?oh=fffa42ca7e85ee6ac6c2101368fdcd8c&oe=57539011

After meeting, we will shuttle with as few cars as possible to the start point.  We will walk a couple of blocks to the Branch Brook Park section of the Lenape trail and begin following it to the north and west.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/229248_10150203567126777_730060_n.jpg?oh=f8050f2dc26c840e2eaaa99a969edc4d&oe=5794917B

The route of the trail is very interesting. Some places it follows back streets, but much of it is actually off road and on good designated park paths and such. It follows utilities, parks, streams, and much more.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/247355_10150203561291777_1180285_n.jpg?oh=572b608dd620f34a126943921a7899bc&oe=5785545C

We will pass through Brookdale Park as well as a couple of the Yantacaw Brook Parks heading to the west. We'll pass over the GSP and through woods which crosses over the Morris Canal Greenway again (It didn't work out to make this one a loop however).


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/229478_10150203554311777_678093_n.jpg?oh=f7e5eaed25a0ee2ba81586756917bb4c&oe=57829603

The trail becomes even more interesting as it then passes along the community garden and enters the Mill Reservation. Here, the characteristics of the NJ terrain change become more apparent. The Piedmont Geological Province before this is never so apparent, as we climb to the outlooks in Mills.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpf1/v/t1.0-9/228285_10150203549001777_4437029_n.jpg?oh=794ec582ea1dd07af531949dacd2ec98&oe=5794D2AF

This is the first place we get a very substantial view of the  NYC Skyline looking back since the Hudson River.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/249444_10150203547191777_3594298_n.jpg?oh=b2d2627200b1974ceb6b7fc7095296bc&oe=5785ACAC

Much of the route from here is a more rugged footpath, a regular hiking trail making it's way to the west around a reservoir and then down to the former Caldwell Branch of the Erie Railroad.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash2/v/t1.0-9/247453_10150203545736777_3124180_n.jpg?oh=1712e269c9aa6fafa1a782322ff6a2a5&oe=578ACF2E

After the Cedar Grove Reservoir section, the trail descends to that railroad bed. The Lenape Trail, and therefore the 911 Trail will then make their way on the railroad bed to the west, but we instead will follow it to the east this time to get back to the cars.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/226303_10150203543841777_5818725_n.jpg?oh=ae2a51368d00df6710cce2b5f142ca4e&oe=574FC5C0

At the end, we will turn onto a little piece of the Morris Canal and follow it to just above the Shop Rite parking lot where we will finish the hike.


https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-prn2/v/t1.0-9/247793_10150203542196777_5411270_n.jpg?oh=2792cbd80372e0ae50c4f5cad8df753c&oe=5754FF06

There are still many bus stops along this route, although the railroad we are closest to on this one does not run on weekends, so that allows for some early out options if they are needed.
Here is an excerpt from our Lenape Trail guide which has not yet made it onto the website. It should be followed in this section in backwards order:

14.47 The Lenape Trail turns right off of the rail bed and ascends through woods to the right. A side trail, unmarked, leaves to the right as well. Follow yellow blazes. The trail makes it's way over interesting topography, and comes out to Ridge Road. The section just before Ridge Road can be very wet, and so it is possible to cut up to the road earlier. Follow the unblazed road walk to the north until the trail re-joins.
15.00 Continue north on Ridge Road. Cedar Grove Reservoir is to the right.
15.40 At the utility right of way, the trail turns right off of Ridge Road. It soon turns right off of the right of way and into the woods
16.20 The trail reaches Normal Road. Turn left to reach parking area in 0.1 mile.
16.37 Lenape Trail follows the West Trail to the right.
16.90 The trail comes nearer to homes to the right. Continue. After the trail turns left, the Lenape Trail will leave this trail and head southeast.
17.15 Enter a somewhat cleared area. Continue ahead to an outstanding view atop a Watchung outcropping. There is a foundation from a former tower, and good views to the east. From here, the trail continues north.
17.36 The trail reaches an intersection with another trail and turns right.
17.51 The trail turns hard right at another intersection. Be sure to follow the yellow Lenape Trail blazes as not to follow side trails which often turn away.
17.68 The trail crosses Highland Ave. It then emerges at the end of Laurel Place, a dead end street.
17.82 Cross Upper Mountain Ave, followed by the Montclair Boonton Line of NJ Transit at the railroad station.
17.90 Turn left along Valley Road
18.12 Turn right along Alexander Avenue.
18.30 Cross Norwood Ave, and continue on Alexander
18.41 Cross Park Street and continue on Alexander
18.50 Pass Park Terrance and Alexander Court, continuing along Alexander Ave.
18.56 Cross Grove Street and continue.
18.92 Turn right on Stonehenge Road.
18.98 The road splits to form a loop. Keep to the right side of the loop and turn right on a path along the north side of Tuers Park.
19.09 Reach Heller Way and continue straight.
19.15 Turn left on Yantacaw Brook Road
19.40 Pass Heller Drive on the left
19.49 At the intersection with Club Road, continue straight on a paved path into Yantacaw Brook Park.
19.54 Another paved path leads right to the end of Bellegrove Drive. Continue to the left past a small pond. Continue around the lake, closer to it's shore where another trail leads ahead to Woodmont Road. Lenape Trail continues on to Glenside Terrace.
19.67 Reach Glenside Terrace and continue straight.
19.80 Reache Belleview Avenue and cross to enter Brookdale Park. Turn right on a paved trail within the park.
19.88 Turn right at a fork in the path. Just ahead, continue left where a path leads right to Dryden Road. Skirt tennis courts on the left.
20.06 Cross the entrance road to Brookdale Park, followed by a paved path. Soon, another paved path turns right to cross West Circuit Drive further into Brookdale Park, and more turn right to Wildwood Ave. More side paths ahead lead to connections to Chester Road, Vernon Road, Gordonhurst Ave, Ridgewood Ave, Hawthorne Ave, and Lovell Terrace. Other paths lead left further into Brookdale Park.
20.65 An access to the right leads to Emerson Terrace. Ahead, the trail continues on between Whittier Terrace and the entrance road to Brookdale Park.
20.79 Turn left on Watchung Ave
20.88 Cross Broad Street and continue.
20.97 Turn right and follow Club Street.
21.08 Turn left along Mohr Avenue.
21.17 Cross Bell Street
21.27 Turn right onto Clair Street.
21.34 At a school, turn left through a parking area and then along the school's east side.
21.43 Turn left on a paved path past baseball fields.
21.56 Another path comes in from the right. It leads to Brookdale Gardens community. The Lenape Trail continues ahead across a small foot bridge.
21.62 The trail emerges on Bessida Street and continues.
21.71 Turn left on Broughton Ave.
21.86 Turn right on Pilch Street
21.96 At the end of Pilch Street, a pathway leads to the right. It leads up onto a foot bridge over the Garden State Parkway. This same foot bridge should also be used when tracing the Morris Canal's historic route.
22.06 Reach the east side of Pilch Street and continue across East Passaic Avenue.
22.15 Turn left on Sadler Road
22.20 Turn right on Watchung Place
22.35 Reach the intersection with Glenview Road and cross onto a power line, then turn right immediately along a buried pipe right of way.
22.55 Cross over the intersection of Glenview Road, Ridge Road, and Chestnut Street and continue on the buried pipe right of way, passing a ball field on the left.
22.80 Cross Bloomfield Avenue and continue across on Church Street
23.22 Reach North Franklin Avenue. Turn left and then cross North Franklin at the crosswalk, continuing along Booth Drive near Nutley Library.
23.38 Cross Vincent Drive and enter Booth Park. Soon join a paved path along the river.
23.48 Turn left and cross the river on a pedestrian bridge, then turn right along the other side.
23.73 Cross Centre Street
23.88 Turn right and cross the river once again on a foot bridge, then turn left along the other side. Soon turn left along Ravine Road.
24.04 Reach Harrison Street and turn left across the river on the road bridge.
24.10 Cross Harrison Street to the right and follow Ernest Street south.
24.27 At a ninety degree bend in the road, continue slightly to the left along a utility right of way.
24.41 Along the utility right of way, cross power lines.
24.54 Cross Chestnut Street on the right of way near the intersection with Moore Place.
24.64 Reach and turn right along Passaic Ave
24.77 Turn sharp to the right to remain on Passaic Ave.
24.86 Turn left along Joralemon Street
25.15 Turn to the right and follow Garden Avenue
25.45 A golf course borders Garden Ave on the right.
25.70 Reach Belleville Ave and turn left.
25.85 Cross Belleville Ave at a crosswalk and enter Belleville Park on a paved path near ball fields. Skirt the ball fields to the left. Watch the yellow blazes because other pathways break off!
25.94 At a fork in the path, turn right, just south of the ball fields.
26.13 At a four way intersection with paved paths, turn left to cross Mill Street. After the street, a foot bridge crosses the Second River. Do not cross, but rather turn left to descend to another path below. NOTE: This section of trail should be a re-route. The original route remained on this side of the river, and continued out to Franklin Ave.
26.27 Turn left on a path along the Second River.
26.34 Turn right along Park Drive to cross the Second River bridge. On the other side, immediately turn right onto a path that parallels the river.
26.52 Pass beneath the foot bridge over the river.
26.63 Pass under a railroad bridge parallel with Mill Street.
26.74 Remain parallel with Mill Street to the right at a fork in the road.
26.85 Reach North Franklin Street and turn left over the crosswalk, then immediately turn left into Branch Brook Park. Pass through trees. In the Spring, there is a glorious Cherry Blossom Festival within Branch Brook Park, truly a sight to see.
27.00 The trail crosses a Branch Brook Park roadway on a crosswalk. It then turns right, then loops around to join another paved path to the right.
27.25 Another paved path comes in from the left.
27.34 Turn left at another intersection from beside baseball fields through trees. Continue on the paved path skirting the east side of the park.
27.53 Reach the Branch Brook Park Road and turn left on the paved path parallel with the road, passing beneath an abandoned rail line.

https://scontent-dfw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/225432_10150203545951777_2456747_n.jpg?oh=af66b47cf90540c784714aa1d88df92d&oe=579735B2

For any questions or concerns, contact me at[masked]
Hope to see you on the trail
results.how_to_find_us: Park at the far west side of the lot well away from most of the customers as not to take up all of their space.
results.name: 911 Memorial Trail Hike Part 4; Newark and Little Falls

group.name: Metrotrails: NJ, PA, NY Metropolitan Area Hiking and More!

results.description:
[UPDATE 26-MAY]

Finally the weather looks very promising. The ride is on.

We will meet up with riders from the HVMR group in Scarsdale for a joined trip.

PLEASE PLEASE NOTE: We will need to leave Bayside 1/2 hr earlier than planned as we need to be in Scarsdale by 10 am. So we are leaving Queens at 9:30 sharp. I have updated our meetup time accordingly.

See you all Sun am for a great day!


* * *


Unfortunately, this weekend looks wet again (sigh). I've changed the ride date to Memorial weekend Sunday. Pls update your RSVPs if this affects your plans. Also, I will try to arrange to join another meetup group together on this trip for a larger group and more fun. This is unconfirmed for now. I will post an update on that some time next week.

* * *

There hasn't been much going on in this group recently, so I elect to propose a ride. Plus, what better way to meet new buddies and make new friends than to schedule a ride???

The weather looks terrrrific this coming weekend. Up for bids is a day ride this Saturday! We will ride to northern CT to a place called Haystack Mtn SP. There is a stone tower there which we will climb and enjoy the views from.

There will be tons of beautiful vistas to enjoy on our way with some countryside sections thrown in for good measure. We will largely ride back roads and enjoy the scenery. Most of the route is in western CT. We will pass by many lakes, ride along and cross several rivers. We will stop on the way back by a dam/waterfall.

We will keep our time on highways to minimum. This is a site-seeing expedition, not a speed daemons' race. Show your competence by doing the twisties gracefully and confidently. Sport bikes preferred (for the twisties) but all skill levels welcome. We will wait for the congregation to assemble as needed.

Bring plenty of water and snacks for the scenic rest stops away from civilization to relax, stretch limbs, marvel, take pics, eat and otherwise chill.

I ask that you please RSVP early if possible. This is for me to get an idea how many riders may be going and get a feel for the general skill level of riders in the group so that I can plan the pace, logistics and fine-tune the route.

Meet at 9:30am at Burger King parking lot on Rte 25A, Bayside, Queens, NY (see map). Leave at 10 sharp. I will announce detailed agenda for the day and offer a safety briefing before we move out. Trip length is 250 miles or thereabouts.

Please prepare your bodies (rest) and equipment (service) ahead of time. Have good breakfast on the day. Gas up before the ride, don't disrespect your fellow riders by arriving empty. Bring your ez-pass, if you have it. We will only need it twice, to get over to the Bronx and back. It's much easier that way (and less expensive too).

Please note squids need not apply for this ride. This is a full day trip and I want to make sure everyone gets home safe. Full gear required.

In case of rain, cold weather or otherwise unfavourable aura the trip will be cancelled or rescheduled (for the sole reason we wouldn't see much from the top of the mtn :-))). Please bring a midlayer regardless, Sat morning will likely be chilly before things warm up.

Cheers!!!

PeterD

results.description:
About 23 miles and 9 hours, fast-paced hike across the George Washington Bridge then north along the Palisades on the Batt to Bear Trail and the Old Erie Path to Nyack. Return to NYC by bus.

This hike has beautiful views along the Hudson River; it also has a steep descent and a steep ascent; trails with rocks, tree roots, branches and fallen trees that must be walked, climbed or clambered over and very few drop off points. Also see the park advisory regarding ticks, snakes and poison ivy: Palisades Park Advisory

The route: The Batt to Bear Trail is mapped out over a number of existing trails leading from The Battery in Manhattan to Bear Mountain. We will follow it from the George Washington Bridge Bus Station to Nyack.

After crossing the George Washington Bridge to New Jersey, we'll follow the Long Path north to the Carpenter's Trail, descend a steep rock staircase to the shore, walk north to the Ross Dock Picnic area, then take the Shore Trail north, stop at the Englewood Picnic Area to eat then continue to the Closter Dock trail, which we will follow back up to the top of the Palisades and rejoin the Long Path.

Next, we will take a rest stop at the Palisades Park HQ, then continue along the Long Path to our second lunch break at the State Line Lookout, which has a small cafe. We continue on a short portion of the Long Path past the Lamont Doherty Observatory and enter Tallman Park. At the north end of Tallman Park we enter the village of Piermont and reach the Old Erie Path, which we follow into Nyack, ending at South Broadway and Church Street in front of the Brickhouse bar to catch the bus.

Dropout Points: The first dropout point we reach will be at Closter Dock Road about 9 miles into the hike, then there will be more dropout points as we continue north. All of the dropout points require standing by the side of Route 9 to catch the bus.

Here is the route map: GWB to Nyack

Here is the trail map for Palisades Park, which has most of the hike in great detail including where to catch the bus if you drop out: Palisades Park trails

The return: We should reach Nyack before 6:00 p.m. There is a 5:38 bus that does not stop at the George Washington Bridge Bus Station and arrives at the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 6:50. There is a 6:38 bus that reaches the George Washington Bridge Bus Station at 7:27 and the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 7:52. Fare is $9.75 to the GWB or $11.10 to the Port Authority. Pay the fare in cash on the bus; best to have the exact amount.

Here is the Rockland Coach schedule: Rockland Coach

Meet: 9:00 a.m. at the George Washington Bridge Bus Station temporary waiting room, at Fort Washington Avenue and 179th Street. Take the A train to 175th Street.


Bring lunch, snacks, water. We will take short lunch breaks at the Englewood Picnic Area, which has a snack bar, and again at State Line Lookout, which has a small cafe.

Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: GWB to Nyack via the Batt to Bear Trail

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos
