results.description:
Late Notice Meetup:  Are you planning to be around this weekend? Great, then please join me for one of our favorite walking destinations in Essex County!  Let's meetup for a Sunday AM WALK ONLY at the beautiful 1.7-mile walkway around the reservoir   We will walk around the walkway three times...just a little under 5 miles.  (It's up to you to walk as many times around as you wish.)  Feel free to invite a friend or family member!!

The freshly paved path has a pair of footbridges, nautically themed decorations and lighting, new landscaping, access to hiking trails, and lots of benches and Adirondack chairs for kicking back and enjoying the views across the water walkway around the Orange Reservoir at the South Mountain Reservation Complex. 

We will meet at the Oakdale Parking Lot, off of Cherry Lane, in West Orange, NJ at 9:30AM SHARP.  We've been doing a really great job of showing up at least 10 minutes before the walk, so let's please try to keep up the good work!

This is a great walk for all you "New Sole Mates " to meet everyone and see what a fun group we are.  There are always plenty of people to chat with and make friends along the way and you will definitely be made to feel welcomed :)!


As a reminder, please remember to wear sunscreen or bring a hat....there isn't any shade around the reservoir.

Looking forward to walking together at this walkway and having another great Sunday morning with all of you!  

Remember, if you can't join us there is no need to post a comment; we'll just see you next time!

Here is more information from JONES BEACH website:

</a><a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a>http://www.jonesbeach</a>;...

Jones Beach State Park


Saturday May 28,2016. WE GOING BOTH DAYS.

and

Sunday, May 29, 2016  WE GOING BOTH DAYS.

Shop

Air Show - May 28 & 29, 2016

</a><a href="http://www.jonesbeach.com/index.php?view=article&catid=57%3Aevents-2014&id=384%3Aair-show-may24-a-25&tmpl=component&print=1&layout=default&page=&option=com_content&Itemid=100055"></a>World Renowned Naval Aviators the Blue Angels will peform over Jones Beach during next year's Memorial Day Weekend celebration, according to the U.S. Navy.<a href="http://edition.cnn.com/2014/03/14/us/blue-angels-fly-irpt/">http://edition.cnn.com/2014/03/14/us/blue-angels-fly-irpt/

The Blue Angels suspended air shows in 2013 because of federal budget cuts, known as the budget sequestration.  The sequestration remains in effect, but the Angels have booked 65 shows in 34 U.S. locations, according to a press release.  "Our peformances provide a unique opportunity to inspire millions to connect with and support our service members, and we are looking forward to an exciting 2014 season," said Blue Angels' commanding officer and flight leader Commander Thomas Frosch.

The Angles fly F/A-18 Hornets.
</a> <a href="http://www.navy.mil/navydata/aircraft/fa18/shornet.html">

U.S. Navy Blue Angels

U.S. Navy  F-18 Super Hornet click here 

also performing: GEICO Skytypers US Army Parachute Team Golden Knights

</a>

SAT-5/28  & SUN-5/29
10AM - 3PM

Admission Price: FREE
Parking Cost: $10.00
Train/Bus Service:<a href="http://www.mta.info/lirr/getaways/Beach/JonesBeach.htm">http://www.mta.info/lirr/getaways/Beach/JonesBeach.htm


Get there early. In the past, this show has easily seen 200,000 people fill up the beach on a single day. It is not unusual for the parking lots to be filled by 11:00am (if not earlier). When this happens, the parkways are closed and people are turned away. So, it is probably a good idea to arrive before 10:00am, or as early as reasonably possible.

SUNSCREEN. Bring it. You will be in the sun for over five hours. Trust me, you will need plenty of it.

BAGS, BACKPACKS, AND COOLERS ARE OK (this is a beach you know), but keep in mind THEY WILL BE SEARCHED so don't bring too much stuff along with you. It will also get crowded near show-center, and extra baggage could make movement difficult. There is a nice fast-food style restaurant on the East end of the beach, and refreshment vendors will be located along the boardwalk. If you want to keep costs low, you may want to bring along your own drinks and snacks. There will be no bleachers or seating of any sort (with the exception of the VIP Chalets that require a separate entry fee purchased before the show), so bring a blanket to sit on, or a foldable chair. If you plan on sitting close to the water, you might want to bring a jacket or long-sleeved shirt. Even though the air temperature may be warm, the waters will still be cold and can cause the area right by the shoreline to be surprisingly chilly.

EARPLUGS are suggested for the younger viewers (under 3 years), but aren't a bad idea for some of the grown-up viewers as well. The jets can get loud, and you might get stuck next to some annoying guy who won't shut up about his cats.

Photography is always fun at an air show, but there are several things to keep in mind, and you should know the limits of your camera. Even though the planes will be close, they will still be far enough away that you will need a decent amount of zoom. The beach faces South, directly into the sun, so most everything will be backlit all day. Also, the air tends to get quite hazy, making it difficult to get a crisp shot. Don't let these handicaps prevent you from bringing your camera, however. You never know what kind of moments you will be able to capture.

KITES ARE PROHIBITED. They can easily distract the performers, and that could result in some rather nasty stuff. Please leave these flying machines at home.

NO PETS. Of course, this excludes animals that aid the handicapped. Unless that animal happens to be a ferret, and if you are using a ferret to lead you around everywhere, you will probably have trouble getting to the show in the first place.


May 28 & 29, 2016
Airshow commences at 10:00 a.m.
Airshow concludes at 3:00 p.m.

WE GOING BOTH DAYS.



Arrive early, Glasses,Sunscreen, Bring lunch, water, hat, suntan lotion. Old shoes or slippers are a good idea because we will be walking on Broadwalk.

Tips for show
Arrive early 
Dress in beach attire 
Bring some warm clothes in case of a temperature change 
Glasses 
Sunscreen 
Hats 
Beach towels and chairs 
Check the website regularly for last minute news items and updates

WALK 4 MILES AT JONES BEACH.

AIR SHOW MAY 28 and May 29,2016. MEMORIAL WEEKEND AT JONES BEACH WALK 4 MILES.


COST FREE IF YOU HAVE MONTHLY OR WEEKLY UNLIMITED METRO CARD.


OR


ONE DAY GATEWAY ROUNDTRIP  OFFERED BY LIRR FROM PENN STATION, MANHATTAN :-

MORE DEATILS BELOW WHEN YOU SCROLL DOWN.


Here is more information from JONES BEACH website:

</a><a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a>http://www.jonesbeach</a>;...

</a><a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a></a><a>http://www.jonesbeach</a>;... 

Bethpage Federal Credit Union Air Show 
Jones Beach State Park


Saturday May 28,2016. WE GOING BOTH DAYS.

and

Sunday, May 29, 2016  WE GOING BOTH DAYS.

Shop

Air Show - May 28 & 29, 2016

</a><a href="http://www.jonesbeach.com/index.php?view=article&catid=57%3Aevents-2014&id=384%3Aair-show-may24-a-25&tmpl=component&print=1&layout=default&page=&option=com_content&Itemid=100055"></a>World Renowned Naval Aviators the Blue Angels will peform over Jones Beach during next year's Memorial Day Weekend celebration, according to the U.S. Navy.<a href="http://edition.cnn.com/2014/03/14/us/blue-angels-fly-irpt/">http://edition.cnn.com/2014/03/14/us/blue-angels-fly-irpt/

The Blue Angels suspended air shows in 2013 because of federal budget cuts, known as the budget sequestration.  The sequestration remains in effect, but the Angels have booked 65 shows in 34 U.S. locations, according to a press release.  "Our peformances provide a unique opportunity to inspire millions to connect with and support our service members, and we are looking forward to an exciting 2014 season," said Blue Angels' commanding officer and flight leader Commander Thomas Frosch.

The Angles fly F/A-18 Hornets.
</a> <a href="http://www.navy.mil/navydata/aircraft/fa18/shornet.html">

U.S. Navy Blue Angels

U.S. Navy  F-18 Super Hornet click here 

also performing: GEICO Skytypers US Army Parachute Team Golden Knights

</a>

SAT-5/28  & SUN-5/29
10AM - 3PM

Admission Price: FREE
Parking Cost: $10.00
Train/Bus Service:<a href="http://www.mta.info/lirr/getaways/Beach/JonesBeach.htm">http://www.mta.info/lirr/getaways/Beach/JonesBeach.htm


Get there early. In the past, this show has easily seen 200,000 people fill up the beach on a single day. It is not unusual for the parking lots to be filled by 11:00am (if not earlier). When this happens, the parkways are closed and people are turned away. So, it is probably a good idea to arrive before 10:00am, or as early as reasonably possible.

SUNSCREEN. Bring it. You will be in the sun for over five hours. Trust me, you will need plenty of it.

BAGS, BACKPACKS, AND COOLERS ARE OK (this is a beach you know), but keep in mind THEY WILL BE SEARCHED so don't bring too much stuff along with you. It will also get crowded near show-center, and extra baggage could make movement difficult. There is a nice fast-food style restaurant on the East end of the beach, and refreshment vendors will be located along the boardwalk. If you want to keep costs low, you may want to bring along your own drinks and snacks. There will be no bleachers or seating of any sort (with the exception of the VIP Chalets that require a separate entry fee purchased before the show), so bring a blanket to sit on, or a foldable chair. If you plan on sitting close to the water, you might want to bring a jacket or long-sleeved shirt. Even though the air temperature may be warm, the waters will still be cold and can cause the area right by the shoreline to be surprisingly chilly.

EARPLUGS are suggested for the younger viewers (under 3 years), but aren't a bad idea for some of the grown-up viewers as well. The jets can get loud, and you might get stuck next to some annoying guy who won't shut up about his cats.

Photography is always fun at an air show, but there are several things to keep in mind, and you should know the limits of your camera. Even though the planes will be close, they will still be far enough away that you will need a decent amount of zoom. The beach faces South, directly into the sun, so most everything will be backlit all day. Also, the air tends to get quite hazy, making it difficult to get a crisp shot. Don't let these handicaps prevent you from bringing your camera, however. You never know what kind of moments you will be able to capture.

KITES ARE PROHIBITED. They can easily distract the performers, and that could result in some rather nasty stuff. Please leave these flying machines at home.

NO PETS. Of course, this excludes animals that aid the handicapped. Unless that animal happens to be a ferret, and if you are using a ferret to lead you around everywhere, you will probably have trouble getting to the show in the first place.


May 28 & 29, 2016
Airshow commences at 10:00 a.m.
Airshow concludes at 3:00 p.m.

WE GOING BOTH DAYS.



Arrive early, Glasses,Sunscreen, Bring lunch, water, hat, suntan lotion. Old shoes or slippers are a good idea because we will be walking on Broadwalk.

Tips for show
Arrive early 
Dress in beach attire 
Bring some warm clothes in case of a temperature change 
Glasses 
Sunscreen 
Hats 
Beach towels and chairs 
Check the website regularly for last minute news items and updates

DIRECTION TO JONES BEACH BY USING SUBWAY AND BUS:


ALL THE WAY TO JONES BEACH AND COST FREE IF YOU BUY YOUR WEEKLY UNLIMITED METRO CARD  or its FREE with WEEKLY OR MONTHLY UNLIMITED METRO CARD:


One day Gateway trip to Jones Beach cost youFREE  if you use WEEKLY UNLIMITED Metro card and subway from Manhattan to Jones Beach. If you have WEEKLY OR MONTHLY Metro Card than no cost you nothing extra.

Subway,Bus N-4 and and then Bus N-88 all have FREE TRANFER with your metro card. Tansfer are free on subway and bus ride if you buy WEEKLY GATEWAY METRO CARD  or if you have a  MONTHLY Unlimited Metro Crad.

Take E train from Manhattan to JAMAICA CENTER/ARCHER AVENUE and walk towards to bus station and take Long Island Bus # N-4 To Freeport rail station. than take N-88 from Freeport Rail station to Jones Beach and get off at West Boat House in Jones Beach.

To get 9:45 am to Jones Beach, You should start from Manhattan by E train about 6:30 am so you can reach at Jamaica Center/Archer Ave in Queens before 7:20 am.Take 7:30 am Bus # N-4 from Parsons/Archer Ave when you get off from E train subway. IF YOU MISS THE 7:30 BUS, THERE IS BUS EVERY 15 MINUTES AFTER THAT.Take n-4 long island bus at 7:30 am bus take you to Freeport at 8:28 am than take N-88 bus at 8:35 am and reach Jones beach at 9.10 am.

You can take another N-4 bus at 7.50 am to get to Freeport at 8:48 AM.next N-88 at 9.05 AM ,next bus N-88 is 9.35 am, then next N-88 at 10.05 am.

If you want to come late or noon time, still you can get there.There is several speaical bus N-88 provide from Free Port LIRR station for Jones Beach.

WHEN YOU TAKE YOUR RIDE BY SUBWAY TRAIN E. to JAMAICA CENTER/ARCHER AVE- THEN WALK TOWARDS TO GET N-4 BUS .  N-4 BUS TAKE YOU TO FREEPORT LIRR STATION, WHERE YOU WILL TRANSFERED TO N-88 BUS FOR JONES BEACH. PLEASE GET OFF AT FIRST STOP ONE'S BUS N-88 ENTERED IN JONES BEACH AREA AND WALK TOWARDS TO BEACH.YOU WILL FIND YOU NEXT TO WEST BATH HOUSE A TWO STORY BUILDING.

OUR MEETING PLACE IS INFRONT OF WEST BATH HOUSE, YOU WILL  SEE SIGN FOR FRIENDLY ICE CREAM PARLOR. AND YOU WILL SEE ARMY STRONG TRUCK. THERE IS REST ROOM THERE.THAT LOCATION FOR US TO MEET FROM 9:30 AM TO 10.15 AM AFTER WEWALK AROUND THAT AREA.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE DESCRIPTION OF THIS EVENT CAREFULLY.

I TAKE THE RSVP PROCESS SERIOUSLY AND EXPECT THAT YOU SHOULD TOO.

I have led this hike for AMC for many years now on Memorial Day weekend.

 Join me and AMC club members who do not have to RSVP on a fun fast paced four mile hiking tour of Central Park concentrating on the lower and middle part of the Park. We will move at a fast pace but we will stop a number of times to talk very briefly about what we see. Central Park is really a work of art and you will see why. You’ll learn about the history of the Park and its unique design features that many people are unaware of. You will be sure to see things you never saw before. Since its Memorial Day Weekend, we’ll visit a few war memorials as well. Even if you have done this with me before-there is always something new. I have led a shorter modified version of this hike for The Guides Association of NYC (GANYC) . This event will be even better.

I will not be leading most of my city hikes for AMC in the future except I hope to continue to lead a few hikes in the woods from time to time and hopefully I will lead this Memorial Day weekend event on an annual basis as well as some other hikes I have led on holiday weekends. 

We will meet BEFORE 10:00 A.M. Be ready to go. WE LEAVE ON TIME. NO FOOD STOPS.

MEETING DETAILS WILL BE SENT BY E-MAIL TO THOSE WHO RSVP ON THE FRIDAY EVENING BEFORE THE HIKE.

 Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. 

Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails from Yahoo. (Contact me if you are a dues paying AMC Club member and don’t get these e-mails and I’ll tell you how). Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process –see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. Some priority will be given to those who have previously attended other AMC Meetup events that I have led.

 I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See the Accuweather website like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 7:00 A.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will probably finish by 1:30 in mid Park.
results.name: Unlock the Secrets of Central Park, Sunday-Memorial Day Weekend

results.description:
Registration on the L.L. Bean website is required to attend this event. Visit www.llbean.com/ridgehill to reserve your spot.

The cost for this course is $ 25.00 per person 

Our Kayaking Discovery Course is a great way to learn the basic paddling techniques and safety skills of this popular sport.

Prerequisite: NoneActivity level: EasyMinimum age: 8 (14 and under with parent or guardian)Questions? Please call[masked]Course Description

Exploring nature in a kayak is a healthy and fun way to enjoy the outdoors. Our course begins with a brief introduction and safety talk from our friendly paddling instructors, who will share their knowledge gained from years of kayaking. They'll outfit you with a personal flotation device (PFD), kayak and paddling equipment, giving you insight on the best ways to set up your boat. Then, you'll receive instruction on a variety of paddling techniques.

After you feel comfortable on the water, you'll set out in a kayak on a guided, interpretive tour with your group. You'll experience the freedom of skimming across the water, learning about the ecosystem and history of the area.

All necessary paddling equipment is provided.

L.L.Bean does not usually cancel events due to inclement weather. However, we reserve the right to cancel an event at any time due to severe weather, low enrollment or other concerns. If L.L.Bean cancels your event, you will receive a full refund for the cost of your reservation.

Cancellation and Rescheduling Policy

*Synthetic clothing dries quickly and is the best choice for outdoor pursuits. Please do not wear cotton clothing. When wet, cotton rapidly robs the heat from your body and takes a long time to dry. We also recommend you dress in multiple layers, allowing you more flexibility to comfortably respond to the weather conditions and your level of exertion.
results.name: Kayaking Discovery Course

results.description:
Haystack Mtn ride, take #2. The ride is scheduled for Memorial weekend Sunday. If you are staying home please join us for a terrific group ride.

We will travel north towards the CT-MA border near Haystack Mtn SP in Norfolk, CT. There is a stone tower in the small park offering stunning views of surrounding areas.

Official information can be found at

http://www.ct.gov/deep/cwp/view.asp?A=2716&Q=325216

Most of our route will be near the NY-CT border. We will traverse scenic back roads throughout the trip. There will be tons of beautiful vistas to enjoy. We will pass by many lakes; ride along and cross several rivers. On our way back we will stop by the Great Falls waterfall to take more pics, rest, stretch and otherwise enjoy the day out.

We will ride several technical twisty sections. But fear not – we will wait for our congregation to assemble as needed for everyone to catch up. All skill levels and bike types welcome.

Lunch in Norfolk. Please bring water and snacks to keep you energized throughout the day. It will take us a few hours to get to our destination.

Please RSVP early if possible so that I can finalize the logistics of our ride.

Meet at 10 am, leave shortly thereafter. The total distance should tally up to around 200 miles. Plan on a 7-hour fun day. I will announce detailed agenda for the day before we move out.

Please gas up before the ride.

Let’s hope the weather cooperates this time and I won’t need to reschedule the ride yet again… Please keep your fingers crossed and see you all soon!

PeterD
results.name: Ride to Haystack Mtn SP

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Event Type: Tour

Admission: Free

Part 1 - Queens Botanical Garden

Description:

The Queens Botanical Garden began as part of the 1939 New York World's Fair in Queens. After the fair, the garden expanded to take up a larger portion of Flushing Meadows Park. When work begun on construction of the 1964 World's Fair, the garden was moved to a site across the street from Flushing Meadows Park to a location atop the stream bed of Kissena Creek.

The Queens Botanical Garden now consists of 39 acres (158,000 m²) of rose, bee, herb, and perennial gardens. It is open to the public. Wedding photography is popular on the lawns by appointment. Among other attractions, the garden hosts a Bee Garden.

Highlights for the month of May:

Map:

Part 2 - Lunch

Part 3 - Amazing Indian Temple (The Hindu Temple Society of North America)

This is an amazing Southern Indian Hindu temple in the middle of Flushing surrounded by Chinese and Korean neighborhoods.

Reference Links:

http://www.queensbotanical.org/

https://nyganeshtemple.org/

END
results.name: Explore Queens Botanical Garden + Amazing Indian Temple (Free Admission)

results.description:
The Program today will be: 

Jim Scott – “Gaia, Mother Earth and the Oneness of Everything.”


Jim will perform original songs and readings with his personal reflections on the idea of Mother Earth or “Gaia” being one living organism. A “spiritual response” in word and action is so timely now, as “the spirit of life on earth is in crisis.” Jim’s uplifting songs provide the balance to the wake-up call, leaving us a vision and inspiration to take the healing into our own hands. From his work with the Paul Winter Consort, where he was co-composer of their celebrated “Missa Gaia / Earth Mass” Jim has long been an activist for peace and the earth with his music. Former Co-Chair of the UU Ministry for the Earth, Jim helped create the “Green Sanctuary” program.


No Ethical Education classes for children on this holiday weekend.

9:30 a.m. - Colloquy - Self-reflection and meditation on a chosen subject within a nurturing, protected group environment.  Leader's Study.
results.name: Jim Scott, Folksinger!

Two of our favorite and active members are moving in together and need our help doing it. Mike and Re'l have both hosted and organized GA events and now we have a chance to show our thanks. This Sunday we need as many of you as possible to meet at Re'ls apartment at 11:00am to help load up a uhaul and unload at their new place on 104th street. Food and drinks will be provided. If you cant show up on time feel free to call Mike to find out where everyone is. [masked]

See you this Sunday.

From Mike:

Thanks everyone! We really appreciate the help!
We have a 15ft u-haul truck from 10am-10pm 


I will get the truck at 10am and drive to R'el's apt where everyone available will load the truck with stuff. The official move-out time for R'el's apartment is scheduled with management for 1-3pm with a hard stop. We then we drive to the new apartment and unload everything. We have two (2) paid movers arriving at the new apartment and working from 3:30pm-6:30pm to unload the truck into the new apartment.

I also need to get my stuff from my apartment in central harlem and my parents place on the upper east side. So we will drive to my place in Central Harlem and load up, then go to my parents on the UES and do the same. We then drive to the new apartment and unload everything ourselves. This will be easier because I have less bulky stuff...promise!!

Default location to go to is R'el's apartment if you are arriving before 3pm. Early birds are welcome to come with me to get the truck at 10am.

results.description:
Hello Yogi's! So excited to meet you and to share the amazing practice of Yoga with you! Below are a few more details so you know exactly what you need and what you can expect:


1. Exact meeting place - here

2. Please bring your own mat, or blanket, or towel.

3. Please only RSVP if you definitely plan on coming - it really helps me with planning - finding a space in the park for 5 people is much different then finding one for 20. Besides emergency situations members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group.


4. To ensure this is an enjoyable experience for everyone I've capped the class at 25 people- which brings me back to #5...please only RSVP if you definitely plan on coming.

5. My classes are a combo of Hatha, Vinyasa and Restorative. What that means is that I like to get our bodies moving with a few faster moving sequences to warm up our muscles, then hold some poses for a few breaths and then take our time to slow our bodies down.

6. Any skill level is welcome, however please note that my classes are more geared towards the beginner/intermediate students.

7. Have fun! This group is meant to be a safe space where people can come together and practice yoga - no matter your experience! Be kind with yourself and know that no matter where you are in the your yoga practice, it is exactly where you are meant to be in this moment.

results.description:
GEEK PRIDE DAY is a celebration of geekdom. Do you enjoy sci-fi, board games, video games, comic books, anglophilia, cosplay, anime, steampunk, zombies, etc? This day is for YOU! Join us as we proudly let our geek flags fly on May 29.

What do you get with your ticket purchase? Read on!

NOMS-An all-day BBQ (with vegetarian & vegan options!), excellent homemade desserts, and much more!

MUSIC & KARAOKE-With a huge selection of songs to choose from, there's bound to be something for you to belt out, from our very own WG DJ.

ZOMBIE TAG-taaaaaaaaaaaaaag!

BAKE-OFF - Show off your baking skills and claim your rightful place as champion - there can be only one! GIANT JENGA - A radioactive* twist on the old classic. (*not actually radioactive)

SCAVENGER HUNT - Race against the other teams, using your skills to solve problems, and be the first to find all the items hidden in Westchesteros. Scavenger Hunt expertly designed by our very own Yeti. BOARD GAMES - There will be great selection of fun board games to play, or feel free to bring your own!

BOCCE - That's no bocce ball! It's a space station!

COSPLAY CATWALK - If you like to make costumes or just dress up like your favorite characters from comics, games, books or movies, show off your skills and fandom.

results.description: The Sunday School at the Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County helps children aged 2-14 explore and develop their moral and critical thinking skills through fun and interactive lessons and field trips. We meet weekly at 11am on Sundays for 1.5 hours while the adults of the Ethical Culture Society are attending the platform meeting. Our wide ranging curriculum allows kids to examine themselves, their community and the world in general. We teach about different cultures, philosophies and religions. We encourage our students to ask questions, think for themselves and make up their own minds about the bigger questions in life. Our children develop strong values and ethical standpoints. The Sunday School Graduation Rite of Passage, completed by our 8th graders, allows them to present to the community how their Sunday School experience has informed their moral and ethical development.

group.name: The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Most people who’ve lost loved ones know that expressions of easy hope aren’t helpful in one’s deep despair. As human beings, we have an ability to and a need to mourn.  And while we want to be people of action on social justice issues — climate change, racial justice, ending poverty, so much more — sometimes we just need to mourn for the world as it is, to then find the deep values that will keep us working for change, whether or not there’s a strong likelihood of success.  Sometimes, we need to really let ourselves feel despair, in order to remember why it is that we need to act.  Our Leader, Jone Johnson Lewis, leads this morning’s interactive program.

© Rjmiguel | Dreamstime Stock Photos

“Our job as a movement is no longer just about reducing emissions—we still have to do that, but we also have this new challenge of maintaining our humanity as we navigate this period of rapid and intense change. And with that challenge, with that job, we can’t avoid the spiritual aspect of what we’re doing. We can’t avoid talking about our most fundamental principles, and our most fundamental values, and the things that we want to hold on to the most. We can’t avoid talking about our larger worldview and our vision for the world.” 

--Tom DeChristopher
results.how_to_find_us: Visit www.rysec.org/directions
results.name: The Blessing of Despair

results.description:
Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on 173 West 108th street , The entrance gate is located on west 108th street and Manhattan ave.

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed! 

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the field.

Paul.

results.description:
With great pleasure we announce our 3rd Annual CHA Memorial Day picnic for the cannabis community on Governor's Island. This year's picnic marks the second anniversary of the CHA and our 3rd picnic on Governor's Island. Unfortunately no open use of alcohol is allowed on Governor's Island. We will have water, soft drinks, and sandwiches on the island.

We can be found near the Starbucks in Ligget Terrace. Please join us for another fun and FREE event of advocacy. The CHA will have printed lectures on cannabis to give to our Members and Affiliates as well as passers-by interested in learning more about cannabis. In the past we've had great success gathering the community and educating, raising awareness and having a heck of a time. So if you plan on having a great Memorial Day, please join us for a fun day of advocacy on Governor's Island! We will post directions to the island as we get closer!
results.name: CHA 3rd Annual Memorial Day Picnic!!!

results.description:
Updated 5/16/16

SPRING/SUMMER SCHEDULE

• Saturday @10am - Morningside Park

• Sunday @12pm - Morningside Park

• Tuesday/Thursday @5pm - Riverside Park


Hello!

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

It's important to RSVP so that you can get updates through the Meetup app. Also PLEASE bring a dark shirt and a light shirt so that it helps distinguish teams.

See you soon!

Damien 

[masked]
[masked]
@ProfDuchamp

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

results.description:
[DIRECTIONS]: Grand Ave - Newtown [M, R] Walk down Broadway in the opposite direction of Queens Blvd. and make a right on Justice Ave.

We had a great turnout at the meetup last weekend! Let's keep the momentum going! :))

We will meet from 12:30pm-2:30pm on Sunday afternoon at Fay Da Bakery.

Please start by introducing yourself in the language that you are learning followed by your native language.

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes for conversation in Chinese and 30 minutes for conversation in English. The remainder of the time will be spent mingling until it's time to go.

We should be done by 2:30pm but you all are welcome to stick around as long you'd like.

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
After last summer's successful series of rides, BIKING WITH GUYS, returns with the 1st ride of the 2016 season: RIDE TO GOVERNORS ISLAND! 

It's opening weekend, and one of our favorite spots in the city. People who don't have bikes can meet us on Governors Island at 3:00pm, join us for games, a picnic, and can even rent bikes on the Island, too!

ITINERARY: We'll meet at 1:00pm out in front of LUCKY STRIKE LANES (corner of 42nd St/12th Ave) here:


Then we'll ride down the bike path towards the southern tip of Manhattan. For those of you running late or who live closer to downtown, we'll make a pit-stop at 1:30pm IN FRONT OF THE RESTROOMS AT CHRISTOPHER STREET PIER. We'll resume our ride down the Hudson River Park bike path til we get to Governors Island Ferry, then take the 5 minute ferry ride to the Island (don't worry, there's space for all of us and our bikes!). **The ferry costs $2.00 roundtrip.


FEE: a $5.00 donation, with proceeds from this and future rides going to BRAKING THE CYCLE, the annual AIDS RIDE that benefits HOUSING WORKS. (You may pay your tour guide Joey in cash at the event, or via FREE Venmo app before/day of ride)

What you need to bring:

*YOUR BIKE (if you don't have your own, you may rent one for the day at one of the numerous bike shops around the city. You will need to rent your bike before the group meets at 1:00pm, we cannot wait for you to rent your bike after start time. we may decide to change meeting point to a bike rental shop, depending on demand.)

(BIKES WILL BE AVAILABLE TO RENT ON GOVERNORS ISLAND, IF YOU NOT HAVE A BIKE. You should NOT get a Citibike, they require to be checked in every 30-45 minutes, and to be courteous to all the other riders we won't be stopping to swap them out all day!)

*BACKPACK/NAPSACK- to carry all of your supplies

*HELMET- Safety is very important, protect yourself!

*WATER- we all need to keep hydrated

*SNACKS/FOOD- to eat at the picnic, or pick up something along the way

*SHEET OR BLANKET- not required, but it'll be more comfortable to lie on the grass with!

*CASH and ID- if you want to pick up treats and/or drink, some places only take cash. **GOVERNORS ISLAND HAS 2 BEER GARDENS!

*BIKE LOCK- If you have one, you may wish to bring it, just in case we decide to stop somewhere at end of trip and want to lock it up

Every 2 weeks, we'll pick a different part of NYC to bike through, explore, relax in, and set up a picnic or grab a local bite!


***DISCLAIMER: We strongly recommend wearing a helmet for every BIKING WITH GUYS trip. If you rent a bike, helmets are usually included with the rental. Guy Social is not responsible for any possible injuries that may occur during this or any bike trip we host. This is a recreational but not beginners biking event, and you must have some solid basic bicycling skills to partake in this event. We advocate bike safety and biking rules of the road. Any injury is solely the individual's responsibility, and Guy Social or any representative of Guy Social is not liable, financially or in any other manner. By reading these terms,  submitting your RSVP, and attending the event, you understand and agree to these terms.
results.how_to_find_us: 1st meeting spot: Corner of 42nd St/12th Ave (in front of Lucky Strike Lanes) at 1pm/ Christopher street Pier at 1:30pm (across from the bathrooms, along railing)
results.name: BIKING WITH GUYS: Governors Island Opening weekend! // Stay-Cation Day 4

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. You get a 50% discount if you do it the same day as the meetup but has to be scheduled in advance with them. This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately, we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you have belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Personally, I think that this is the BEST dog park in Brooklyn!

I say "dog park" and not "dog run" because this place is HUGE, taking an entire city block! (See Google Map link above.) 


To access the dog park you may use any of the 4 double gated entrances (2 off of Columbia Heights and 2 off of Vine Street).  A separate fenced area for smaller dogs has its own double gated entrance off of Vine Street. 

For wheelchairs and scooters, the entrances off of Vine Street are more manageable since they are on the flatter side of the park.

This dog park is so expansive that one does not even notice the perimeter fencing, mostly concealed by shrubbery! 

Its natural sloping landscapes, combined with many mature trees and assorted shrubbery, literally makes you feel like you are in a forest.

There are ample shaded areas for the Beagle People, several hilly areas to give our dogs a more interesting environment to roam and to run in, a real "wooded area" with many trees and bushes for our dogs to play hide and seek in, several doggie drinking water fountains, a hose down station and a bunch of circular wood benches placed around trees for seating.

Most of the folks that I've met there are local residents of Brooklyn Heights and for a good reason... STREET PARKING IS SOMEWHAT DIFFICULT TO FIND IN THIS AREA! 

The dog park is well maintained by volunteers from the neighborhood and patrons keep it very clean.  

The moment you enter this dog park you know that you are in a special place and in a natural setting... designed by nature, not by the NYC Parks Department (they just installed the perimeter fencing!).  

Its ground surface is a combination of natural grass areas, mulch and dirt.

This might be the largest fully fenced dog park in Brooklyn... and quite possibly, in New York City.  It is absolutely worth the car trip... and the hunt for a parking spot once you get there!  Just allow extra time for that quest. 

You may end up having to walk 2 or 3 blocks from where you can find a parking spot, but it will be worth the extra effort!  (Remember, parking meters are free on Sundays!)

There are NO public restrooms available in the park.

If you are able to attend this MeetUp the best way to find this dog park is by GPS. 

I take the Brooklyn-Queens Express going towards Queens and I get off at the Cadman Plaza West exit (which is one exit before the Brooklyn Bridge exit).  Then I stay on Old Fulton Street and make a right onto Henry Street, where I usually find a parking spot.

Since we also have Members in Manhattan and Queens, this venue is pretty "central" and convenient for everyone... just a stone's throw away from the Brooklyn Bridge!


Here's a preview of what you're in for if you decide to go (I had to take 3 separate videos to capture it all):


https://youtu.be/OdD2Z6Uy2qg


https://youtu.be/S-EFU3__8pE


https://youtu.be/2XXO4vbY2Ik

IMPORTANT:  

Attendance at this MeetUp event is purely voluntary and you do so at your own risk. 

By attending this MeetUp event you agree to hold harmless MeetUp.com, The Beagle Pack!, its Organizers and its Members, who assume NO liability for any injury, accident, loss of property or loss of life resulting from the use of this facility, or traveling to and from this facility; nor can they be held responsible for the actions of any aggressive dogs, irresponsible dog owners or patrons, or any hazardous conditions at this facility.

Hello ladies,
Editing this and rescheduling because I am in bed with a fever. Again. (Being a teacher to the small ones really has its perks, sometimes.)
I changed it to the 29th, same time. My apologies, but hoping everyone stays healthy and sick/allergy-free!
Megan

_______________________________________

Hello all!
I took one of last meetup's recommendations, and decided that next meetup will be a little different. We have been reading a lot of feminist theory/history literature, so I am going to switch it up by choosing a novel which is written by a woman (yay!) and has a woman as the main character throughout the entire book. It will be interesting to discuss, because she  turns to prostitution to make ends meet, but is always aware of who she is.


Here is a summary:

"Near the end of World War II, seventeen-year-old Mireille de Jouarre flees the home of her stepfather, a Nazi collaborator and abusive drunk. She finds shelter with her childhood friend Stefan, and the two fall deeply in love. But as the fighting escalates, Mireille must escape alone to Paris, where she discovers she’s pregnant and lacking a way to provide for her child.

So begins her new life as l’Ange—the Angel. After an unlikely meeting with a wealthy aristocrat in a Parisian hotel—and her acceptance of his solicitation—Mireille becomes the most celebrated poule in all of France, eliciting huge fees and invitations to exclusive parties. At one of these events, Mireille meets Oliver Jordan, an American womanizer and film producer, and is soon launching a promising film career. As her star rises, Mireille is determined to bury her past. But her success isn’t as carefree and glittery as it seems, and when her daughter’s future is threatened, Mireille must make a deadly decision in a desperate attempt to finally choose her own path."

The point of this book club is to constantly inform ourselves, while also celebrating female lead characters. This will be our first fiction book, and a very racy one to boot.

http://www.amazon.com/Mireille-Molly-Cochran-ebook/dp/B00ORBNEP6/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1459727839&sr=8-1&keywords=mireille

As for now, I listed the meetup at my home, until the date gets closer and we can  get a closer idea of what the weather will be like.

In the meantime, RSVP to this, and head on over to the discussion board, where you can find 2 new threads:

1) A shirt/patch option I am working on. Write your name there, and if you have any contributing ideas. I need to get a general idea on how many people would like a shirt for this club.

2) I wrote down last book club's ideas that were collected, but you can always post your  ideas there as well!

Megan
results.name: Mireille- Updated

results.description:
This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, through wooden door to the right, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Agricola, Tzolkin, etc.) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. In addition, many take a long time to teach (Alchemists runs about 30 minutes, Kanban's teach ran 1 hour last time).  Among the shortest games we play are Codenames and Splendor.  If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game. Towards the late evening, Avalon often happens.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.

Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, the card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.

results.description:
No preparation needed for this meeting! Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 3-5pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Hello Everyone!

IF YOU'RE SIGNING UP THE DAY OF (SUNDAY MAY 29TH) -- YOU MUST CALL ME IN ADDITION TO SIGNING UP ONLINE.  I WOULD LIKE YOU TO STAGGER PLAYERS TO COME AT DIFFERENT HOURS.


Happy Memorial Day!
MEMORIAL DAY SUNDAY BASH, Tennis & BBQ
Spend Memorial Day Sunday with old and new friends playing tennis and having BBQ at Packanack Lake! Our holiday parties are always popular and festive. For those who haven't been to the Lake, it's like being at a resort or in your own backyard with a nice deck, overlooking clay courts.  When you are there, you will not think about anything else except fun and relaxation.  All levels are welcome.  You will get 2-3 hours of tennis.  Bring your friends and families.  The More the Merrier!


Sunday, May 29, 2016, 3 PM - 9 PM

Packanack Lake Tennis Club
9 Osborne Terrace, Wayne 07470
(10 outdoor red clay and hard courts)
only 20-30 minutes from the GWB
$25 includes tennis and BBQ
$20 includes food only, non-players

GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENTS
RESPECT FOR SPACE WE SHARE
Please pick up after yourself when you finish eating.  It spoils the environment for everybody else while they're sitting out and socializing during their off hour, sharing the same area.  It's nice to have respect for the space we all share.  Please help me, as I'm juggling many things to create a fun evening for everyone.

BALLS ON COURT
A friendly reminder, please find the 3 balls that you played with and place them by the net for the next group of players.  Often people cannot find the balls or they are mixed in with old balls, not ones from the night's party.

HAND BALLS TO SERVER
Be considerate and wait for the server or the partner to turn around before sending balls over the net.  It's safer, saves time and just good court etiquette.

BE SUPPORTIVE OF YOUR PARTNER
Every once in a while we need to be reminded that we keep a positive attitude on the court.  People come for the enjoyment of the game and to meet other people in a social setting.  Please be a sportsman and be supportive of your partner.  It isn't fun for anyone on the court to see discontent being shown through facial expressions, body language or even scolding.  Let's keep the parties fun and enjoy the evening.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends at the next parties!

Thanks,
Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
Come join us at the BAM/ DanceAfrica 2016 Festival over the Memorial Holiday Weekend for dancing at the Cumbe Dance Center tent-- exact tent location to be announced Saturday afternoon by Cumbe (per BAM Dance Africa).

BAM/DanceAfrica 2016 is the nation's largest festival dedicated to African dance and returns for its 39th year, bringing together performance, art, film, and an array of community events for an exhilarating celebration of culture from Africa and its diaspora.

We'll be there to represent! If you are interested, we are going to dance for the community at 3:30p sharp in front of Cumbe tent at 3 Lafayette in front of Mark Morris Dance Center continue to demo by the tent thereafter. Please meet us by the tent at 3pm in your New York Steppers T-Shirt (black, purple, and red) and comfortable shoes for the street. At 6:00pm that evening (note the time change), we're having our open dance at 333 Lounge, 333 Flatbush (at 7th Ave) not too far up the street from the Festival. Admission is Free! We'll be in celebration mode and go until around 10pm.

Cost: FREE

Any questions, contact Marty at (917)[masked] or [masked]

DanceAfrica 2016-

Senegal: Doors of Ancient Futures

Artistic Director Abdel R. Salaam and Artistic Director Emeritus Chuck Davis

The nation’s largest festival dedicated to African dance returns for its 39th year, featuring new artistic director Abdel R. Salaam. This beloved annual tradition brings together performance, art, film, and an array of community events for an exhilarating celebration of culture from Africa and its diaspora.

This year, DanceAfrica offers a taste of the rhythm, movement, and spirit of Senegal past and present, welcoming two Dakar-based companies: Les Ballets de la Renaissance Africaine “Waato Siita”, featuring the best percussionists and dancers from Senegal; Compagnie Tenane, a dynamic troupe that mixes contemporary styles and traditional Senegalese movement; BAM/Restoration DanceAfrica Ensemble; Germaine Acogny; and Dyane Harvey-Salaam.
results.name: Steppin' at BAM DanceAfrica 2016!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Sunday Pick-up Parade Grounds 3:30 PM

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ Frederick Douglass Playground


                                 Check our Facebook page:

              facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                          NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41MNlrZf-MY

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 7 on 7, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Frederick Douglass Playground


Take the 1,2 or 3 RED Line Train to 96th street Station and walk 4 blocks down, to 101st Street and Amsterdam Ave. or the 1 RED Line Train to 103rd Street Station and walk 1 block.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
Hi all,

In the first part of the May 29th meetup I’m giving an interactive lesson on “Process Thinking vs Fearful Thinking”, a communication lesson which will help equip you for any artistic endeavor as well as in your everyday life. (If you are a writer or director, you will also find the content useful for story and character development.)

For the second hour  I will lead a case study of FROM PAWNS TO KINGS (5 min), produced in a Make a Film Class I taught.  We will read aloud and discuss the student draft of an original script, then the shooting script that was written after class workshoping, and finally view the short film. 

(I will be contacting those of you who have signed up for Sunday to see if you have a  project presentation you want to give.)


I have been thinking about what I hope to get out of starting this meetup group – and how to find out what you want to learn and have to offer.  

I’d like your help in developing a magazine – or tapas – format for our meetings. Rather than teach a class series, I want to offer a segment at each meeting from the things I teach – how to be a good PA, team building, communication and problem solving skills, organizing a low/no budget set, or scriptwriting –  and give you a specific lesson to take away. 

For future meetups I want to reach out to you – the talent – to help provide part of the content.  I love peer teaching.   You don’t have to be an expert to have valuable info to share and get a dialogue going. 

In a separate email to the group I'm sending out a write-up on the goals of the meetup, as well as posting it on the group discussion board -- hoping to get your feedback and ideas.   And I will be following up with your individually.  

The $5 donation helps to cover space rental at Chez Bushwich, our host.

Hope to meet on a Sunday!  - Trayce

Upcoming meetups at Chez Bushwick

Sun June 12,    2:00pm – 4:00pm
Sun June 19,    2:00pm – 4:00pm
Sun June 26,   2:00pm – 4:00pm

results.description:
RC90-Version Fun & Games MeetUp!...


Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games".  

[[ NOTE -- 

Why not bring someone new this week & introduce them to our little family of friendly gamers?...  ;-)

-- NOTE ]]

Come & have some fun!!!

I look forward to seeing you all there!...

FYI for the new meeples, we're averaging a solid 20 ppl per week now (just not everyone RSVPs...)  Speaking of RSVPs, I know MeetUp has a cut-off for RSVPing if you decide to show late so please don't let that hold you back...  I'd love for you to all RSVP, but it's definitely not a requirement (the only requirement is to come and have fun!)

Which Panera?... How to find us?...
FAQ - Location, Location, Location... (or at least Panera Bread's Location ;-)


• http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48006932

Please help us grow!...  please share our group on Google+ & Facebook!

There are "high-res" photos available if you want to print a flyer for work and/or school!

Thanks,

George

a.k.a. Jorge Loco

PS RSVP isn't required, but it'll definitely help me out!

PPS Shall we play a game?

http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48695815/

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
We're doing something a bit different for May's Knit+Wine Night -- a pie potluck picnic in Fort Greene Park! 

Pies can be savory or sweet, homemade or purchased. Idea is that everyone brings one pie  and something to drink (bubbly goes well with pie!) to share. I will bring plates, napkins, cups, and forks.  

Please let me know what kind of pie you plan to make or bring so we can keep track of all the deliciousness!
results.name: Knit+Wine Pie Potluck Picnic !

venue.address_1: 2430 FDR Dr, East Service Road (at E. 23rd St & FDR Dr - New York Skyport Marina)
venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
Join us aboard the 100-foot, two-level party yacht The Cabana, as we cruise around Manhattan, take a look at amazing views of the NYC skyline, statue of liberty, and more! Over 200 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s will be in attendance, and DJ HA will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present.

CRUISE RUNS FROM 7 TO 11PM

All ages welcome!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$25 for our members

Prepay only - Prepay here

http://singlescruisemay.eventbrite.com

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, mix & migfle happy hour.  fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We’ll have complimentary appetizers, fun ice breakers, prizes, and two levels & two cash bars. Our singles sunset cruise gets sold out every year—you won’t want to miss it! Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

Expect to meet singles ages 25-45. This is a multi-group event organized by NYMinuteDating.com

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 6:45pm.  The boat will depart at 7pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.
results.name: Memorial Weekend Singles Harbor Cruise - Ages 25-45

results.description: Hey Champs!! I would like to advise you that there are some openings within our  financial firm!! Are you interested in educating others?? Then this could be for you!! If you are interested you will have to go through a 12 week training course for a fee. There is no experience necessary, but you MUST be coachable, honest, goal orientated and have integrity!! We look to giving everyone an opportunity. Remember, an opportunity is only as good as you make it!! If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to send me a message to my inbox. If you would like you can come sit in the first class of training and we can discuss your thoughts and how you would like to proceed afterwards. If you don't think you will be able to make it to the first class but would still like to attend, inbox me. I will discuss your situation with you and we will see if we can accommodate you. See you all there!! I wish you the best!!
results.name: Financial Education And Literacy QFT (Qualified Field Trainer) Course

results.description:
Please join several dozen professionals for the weekly Sunday 5:30 Contemporary Mass at Holy Trinity Church conveniently located on the upper west side of Manhattan!  This mass is a great way to top off your week with relationship building with God and your peers.

Holy Trinity Church

213 West 82nd Street

Between Amsterdam and Broadway

Every Sunday after mass we gather in front of church for some socializing before heading over to a pre decided venue.  Why not become part of a growing, warm, welcoming and cohesive community!
results.name: Young Adults Mass

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leaders - Joanne & LD)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]
results.name: Sunday Indoor Soccer @ W86th (2 hours 4v4) for Roundstar Foundation

results.description:
NO WORK ON MONDAY FOR MEMORIAL DAY! 

THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO ALL AND IS NOT MEANT TO BE AGE SPECIFIC OR GENDER BALANCED. This is a great event where you can enjoy a great baseball game and make some new friends, and maybe more!.  We will have a premingle with introductions at a local bar prior to the game. 

Prepay required HERE. 
Price goes up 4/18, so register early and save 
($39-$55)

Reservation on/bef 4/18- $39.75 
  4/19- 4/27- 49.75 
  After 4/27- $55.75 (if available) 

Sunday, May 29th- Premingle from 5:45 to 7:45; Game at 8:00 PM 
(Last day for ticket sales is April 27th.  After that you can still check the website to see if we were able to get any additional tickets.)

Singles at Citi Field. 
NY Mets vs. Los Angeles Dodgers 

This is a great event where you can enjoy a great baseball game and make some new friends, and maybe more!.

How it works/ Itinerary 
The game starts at 8:00, however we will have a pre-mingle from 5:45 PM- 7:45 PM at a local bar/pub walking distance to the ballpark (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets.

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. Meeting Locations

NOTE: LONG ISLAND RAIL ROAD- PORT WASHINGTON BRANCH GOES RIGHT TO CITI-FIELD

Our host will greet you, and introduce you to other singles in the group. Food and drink is available for purchaseNOTE: You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 7:45. If you arrive after 7:45 you will not be able to find the group.

Includes

*1 ticket to the game (500 level seating) 
*Pre-mingle to introduce you to other attendees 
Pricing 
$39.75- $55.75 depending on how early you register. 

Prepay required HERE
results.name: Citi Field- Mets Vs. The Dodgers + Premingle (Prepay only)

results.description:
If you'll be spending the long weekend in town, come mix and mingle with members from several meetup groups as we take over Tagine, a unique Moroccan bar/restaurant. With drink specials, good food, music, and even belly dancing, it's sure to be a great night. 

- No cover 

- Drink Specials (6 - 7:30 pm only): 

       Tagine's famous Moroccan sangria  $8 
       Well cocktails                                           $7 
       Bud Light                                                    $5 
       Heineken/Amstel Light                         $6 
       Red/white wine                                        $8

- Dinner menu also available

- Belly dancing performance at 7:30

- Multiple meetup groups invited

- Please note that the "+ xx" next to my name on the attendance list to the right is a count of total RSVP's from outside this group, manually updated every 12-48 hours.  It is NOT an arbitrary number. However, also remember that "no-shows" can never be accurately predicted.

IMPORTANT: You must be at least 21 to attend. There are no other age restrictions.
results.how_to_find_us: Venue is located between 7th and 8th Avenue. Optional name tags will be provided.
results.name: Milton's Memorial Wknd Bash @ Tagine (No Cover, Drink Specials, Belly Dancing)
