results.description:
On Sunday May 29th, we will have our boat cruise to celebrate Memorial Day Weekend! There will be DJ's from New York and Miami playing party tunes. 

We will be sailing around the downtown harbor right by the Brooklyn Bridge, The Statue of Liberty, and more, whilst enjoying the breathtaking views of Manhattan’s sunset. 

There will be a fully stocked bar.

Dance Floor & More.

Boarding Time: 5pm

Departure time: 6pm

Skyport Marina2430 FDR Drive Service Rd 

Dress Code - Business Casual (no flip flops, t-shirts, tank tops, shorts, baseball cap and large bags) 

Purchase ticket from link below:

https://www.dr2tickets.com/affiliate/rory 

Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

After the boat cruise we will take the party to the ever popular TAO Downtown. (Free entry with boat cruise ticket)

Dress code will be in full effect there.

Contact us if you have further questions.

THIS EVENT WILL TAKE PLACE RAIN OR SHINE!

results.description:
This is a great Meetup event where you can enjoy a baseball game, make some new friends, and maybe more!  It doesn't matter if you're a big fan or not, this will be a fun night out at the ballpark for all! Plus, no work on Monday!

Join us by pre-paying here - https://goo.gl/BrViGM

How it works / Itinerary: 

The game starts at 8pm, however we will have a pre-mingle from 6pm-7:45pm at a local bar/pub connected to the ballpark (location announced only to those who have paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you the game tickets.

Our Meetup host will greet you, and introduce you to others in the group. Food and drink will be available for purchase. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 7:30pm. If you arrive after 7:30pm you will not be able to find the group. 

*$39.95-$55.75 depending upon how early your purchase - https://goo.gl/BrViGM

*Price includes a ticket to the game (500 level seating) & pre-mingle. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own. 

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 30 members attending.

How do I attend? In addition to RSVP'ing you must also purchase tickets in advance.  An RSVP alone will not hold your spot and this will sell out!  PREPAY HERE - https://goo.gl/BrViGM
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, week of event date

Sunday May 29th 2016

come anytime within 6pm - 10pm all ages

takes over a Soho Loft for a special
History of Quack Medical themed party for the Museum.
16mm short Movie Fest

Medical Antiques Demos

& A Party!

Play with me! Summer is coming so let's do it on the roof!

We've got a bunch of rad teachers who want to flow with you! so shoot me an email and let's arrange our first meetup!

Suggested donation: $15
Equipment available (limited)

Retreat info here (May 15) https://www.facebook.com/events/1735781833322792/

Live music TBD

Address disclosed with RSVP

My yoga practice began in NYC when I was 18years old and has followed me to San Francisco, Washington, DC Cleveland, London, Brooklyn, and beyond

I play with styles including Anusara; Astanga; Bikram; Hatha; Iyengar; Partner; Restorative; Yin. .. whatever the mood

See you on the mat x

results.description:
After Dance Africa 2016, we'll be at 333 Lounge getting our groove together to celebrate African heritage! Also, to remember all of our African and African-American heroes who have served in the armed forces.

We're off for the Holiday on Monday so this should be a nice Spring shindig.

If you haven't been to 333 Lounge yet, you're in for a nice surprise. Its a great venue with a lot of space for dancing- both front and in the back lounge area.

Where: 333 Lounge

333 Flatbush Avenue (at 7th Ave)

Brooklyn, NY

Time: 6-10pm

Cost: FREE for our community, but support the kitchen and bar!

See you there and come thirsty (and hungry)!  Its a great bar and we'll be dancing into the evening.  Please support your steppers set so we can have great venues like this regularly.

Questions, contact Marty at (917) 302-3808.

BAM Dance Africa 2016-

Senegal: Doors of Ancient Futures

Artistic Director Abdel R. Salaam and Artistic Director Emeritus Chuck Davis

The nation’s largest festival dedicated to African dance returns for its 39th year, featuring new artistic director Abdel R. Salaam. This beloved annual tradition brings together performance, art, film, and an array of community events for an exhilarating celebration of culture from Africa and its diaspora.

This year, DanceAfrica offers a taste of the rhythm, movement, and spirit of Senegal past and present, welcoming two Dakar-based companies: Les Ballets de la Renaissance Africaine “Waato Siita”, featuring the best percussionists and dancers from Senegal.
results.name: PARTY CELEBRATING DANCE AFRICA 2016- Steppers After-Set

The game starts at 8pm, however we will have a pre-mingle from 6pm-7:45pm at a local bar/pub connected to the ballpark (location announced only to those who have paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you the game tickets.

Our Meetup host will greet you, and introduce you to others in the group. Food and drink will be available for purchase. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 7:30pm. If you arrive after 7:30pm you will not be able to find the group. 

*$39.95-$55.75 depending upon how early your purchase - https://goo.gl/BrViGM

*Price includes a ticket to the game (500 level seating) & pre-mingle. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own. 

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  Based on pre-sales already, we will have at least 30 members attending.

How do I attend? In addition to RSVP'ing you must also purchase tickets in advance.  An RSVP alone will not hold your spot and this will sell out!  PREPAY HERE - https://goo.gl/BrViGM

venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
Join us aboard the 100-foot, two-level party yacht The Cabana, as we cruise around Manhattan, take a look at amazing views of the NYC skyline, statue of liberty, and more! Over 200 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s will be in attendance, and DJ HA will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present.

CRUISE RUNS FROM 7 TO 11PM

All ages welcome!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$25 for our members

Prepay only - Prepay here

http://singlescruisemay.eventbrite.com

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off other select events from our calendar (wine tastings, boat cruises, speeddating, advanced degree events, mix & migfle happy hour.  fireman parties.) Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We’ll have complimentary appetizers, fun ice breakers, prizes, and two levels & two cash bars. Our singles sunset cruise gets sold out every year—you won’t want to miss it! Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

Expect to meet singles ages 25-45. This is a multi-group event organized by NYMinuteDating.com

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 6:45pm.  The boat will depart at 7pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

(Photo below from last year's cruise) 

What's included:


• Free Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

• 300 singles (ages 21-45) 

*MUST PREPAY HERE


*First 25 tickets are just $25. Price will go up to $50 as event gets closer so get your ticket today!  

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending. We have multiple groups co-organizing and will have 300+ members attending as we do every cruise.


• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins around 6:30pm. The boat will depart at 7pm SHARP! Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around. By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

results.description:
BALI: 8 Day Group Tour - May 29-June 5, 2016

Join members from all over on this on this exciting 8 day group trip to the tropical island of Bali!

Join other like-minded solo & adventure travelers May 29 – June 5, 2016 and explore the wonders and beauty of the most famous Indonesian island with this 8 day group tour through the majestic island of Bali. You'll travel through lush interior mountains, explore local villages, taste amazing coffee from area plantations, view picturesque rice terrace gardens, and so much more. Best of all, you'll spend plenty of time at the famous Kuta beach... a fantastic way to start and end this amazing adventure!

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Pricing and Booking:

PRICE: $1,599 (airfare additional)

NOTE: a meetup RSVP does NOT reserve your space. For prices, details and to book your space on this tour, please CLICK HERE to Book Your Space.

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

PLEASE NOTE: trips are small groups and they tend to sell out 1 - 3 months before departure, so be sure to book your space before they sell out!  These small group trips are open for anyone to join. You can sign up as a solo traveler (roommate matching is free-OR you can get your own room) OR join with a spouse, friends or other family members. All are welcome!

GET THE SCOOP! Want to see what other club members are saying? Then check out the GEC Testimonial Page.

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

Included in the awesome adventure:

* Expert English speaking local Trip Leader
* Local expert guides for select tours
* Global Expeditions Club Trip Leader
* Expert local guide on tour
* 8 Days, 7 Nights in excellent local hotels
* 4 day guided island tour around the island
* Visit the famous Banjar Hot Springs
* Short guided walk through a picturesque Bali rice field
* Visit to the Ubud market
* Visit to several Balinese Temples
* Breakfast daily, lunch on tour
* Private transportation between cities
* Optional: Elephant Safari day trip

Need help booking your airfare?  Just email me or give me a call at[masked]

Click Here For Complete Details and to Book Your Space on the Trip.

>Places Visited: Bali Group Tour, Bali, Indonesia, Kuta, Denpasar, Ubud, Candidasa, Lovina, Banjar Hot Springs, Lake Beratan, Bedugul

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Global Expeditions Club (GEC) is a group of fun-loving travelers looking for other like-minded people to travel the world with.  The travel club started 8 years ago with just a handful of meetup members, but has grown into one of the largest travel clubs in the world.

Check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page to see what others are saying about these trips.

Of course, if you have any questions you can always contact me or one of the other organizers through meetup message or via phone at (617)[masked]

Make Friends. Travel the World.
results.name: BALI: Tropical Island Group Adventure - 8 Days

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is heated and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 6:45pm.  The boat will depart at 7pm SHARP!  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
Celebrate Memorial Day weekend Sunday with 300+ singles from multiple Meetup groups on our private 4 hour yacht cruise party!  

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with a panoramic view of NYC skyline on a 100 foot long, 2-deck private yacht.  

*This cruise is guaranteed to SELL OUT, as it does every year, so don't wait to get tickets! NO tickets will be sold at the door. 

*MUST PREPAY HERE

(Photo below from last year's cruise) 

What's included: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

• 300 singles (ages 21-45) 

*MUST PREPAY HERE 

*50% off limited tickets available for $25 ($50 otherwise) Only 25 available at this price so get them before they're gone! 

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending. We have multiple groups co-organizing and will have 300+ members attending as we do every cruise. 

• The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins around 6:30pm. The boat will depart at 7pm SHARP! Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around. By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". It is a 21 and older event. Not meant be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced.

• You must get your ticket in advance. RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event. We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

PURCHASE TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/finalcruise/dates/May-29-2016_at_0600PM

results.description:
Revolutionary Road (released December 31, 1961) is author Richard Yates' debut novel. It was a finalist for the National Book Award in 1962 along with Catch-22 and The Moviegoer. When published by Atlantic-Little, Brown in 1961, it received critical acclaim, and The New York Times reviewed it as "beautifully crafted... a remarkable and deeply troubling book."[1]


In 2005, the novel was chosen by TIME as one of the 100 best English-language novels from 1923 to the present.[2]


When DeWitt Henry and Geoffrey Clark interviewed Yates for the Winter 1972 issue of Ploughshares, Yates detailed the title's subtext:


I think I meant it more as an indictment of American life in the 1950s. Because during the Fifties there was a general lust for conformity all over this country, by no means only in the suburbs—a kind of blind, desperate clinging to safety and security at any price.[3]
results.name: "Revolutionary Road" by Richard Yates

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Ari Shaffir, Gregory K. Nick Griffin, Greer Barnes, Godfrey, Christian Finnegan, Jon Laster, Damien Lemon and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup 2 drink min. Free Tickets for this group!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP TO THE WAIT LIST!! In order to prevent spammers from taking  the slots of real users we have to fill the slots from the wait list until further notice.


Episode 6 "Blood of My Blood"

All are welcome. If you are a fan of the HBO Game of Thrones and want to join a group of fellow fans, come on in. If you are a full fledged Maester who has read all of the books (and even the extras like Dunk & Egg) come join us and watch the marvelous series with a group of fellow Maesters. Discussion about anything we just watched is encouraged here (and since the show has passed the books, talk about the books is also encouraged). This group does not consider mentioning Ned Stark's beheading in Season 1 during Season 6 to be a spoiler.*

There is a delicious and very affordable menu of food and drinks for you to enjoy when you get here.

8PM

Discuss, debate, and compare notes while watching last week's show.

9PM

Watch new episode (without debate or talking so we don't miss anything).

10PM

Socialize and discuss the show.

Come early to get the best seats.

*It is highly recommended that people who consider a wide range of topics to be spoilers watch the show alone at home with the doors locked and the internet disconnected. Make sure to also avoid all news outlets.
results.name: Game of Thrones Season 6 Episode 6

Our Memorial Day Bar-B-Q and Picnic has a limit on the number of attendees. Because we are going to be in a public park, we can not simply have 100's of people showing up for our event. Our answer was to create an after party. If you could not register for the Memorial Day Bar-B-Q and Picnic because of the attendee limit, you can still come to the after party, which has no limit.

The Memorial Day Lounge Party is going to be in a Midtown Manhattan location that is going to be announced 3 days prior to the event.

Everybody from the Memorial Day Bar-B-Q and Picnic will be there. This includes; models, photographers, makeup artists and DJs. You can meet the Asian Fashion in New York models, have a drink, and be a part of our Memorial Day Lounge Party Photo Shoot while networking with business professionals. Don't be shy, come and join us on Memorial Day! Please sign up early so we may properly plan.

Thank you,
Erik

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN

results.description:
Hey Challengers,

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

All you need to do is to RSVP so that you are on the list.

Please RSVP for each week that want to be included so that I know you're in.

Hope you'll participate in the next Weight Loss Challenge in October!

I'd love to see you!

Hope to see you real soon!

 

All the very best,

Jae

results.description:
*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet by the fountain in the middle of the park.
results.name: HIIT Workout

results.description:
This is a 4.25mi guided hike. The hike is 1.5 hours without a break and 2 hours with two 15 minute breaks, etc.

Business conversations are highly encouraged, but pitching/selling is strongly discouraged for the duration of the hike.

We will take 2 short breaks:

1. Guided breathing exercise (good for relaxation in any situation).

2. Gratitude assignment.

10 Points For Safety:

1. Stay with the group.

2. Follow and stay on the trail.

3. Do not interact with any wildlife. Photos are okay at a safe distance.

4. Hydrate well the day before.

5. Wear comfortable hiking, running or walking shoes with good tread. Trails are somewhat rocky in places.

6. Do not join if you have a heart condition, are pregnant, are visually or hearing impaired or have severe allergies without consulting your physician first. 

7. All hikers will be added to an official roster only upon signing a release prior to the hike.

8. Pay attention to your surroundings at all times. Watch for tree limbs, rocks, animals and other hazards always.

9. Buddy up. Keep track of your buddy and stay together.

10. Don't overdo it. Only you know when you're tired or injured. You are completely responsible for your own well-being and safety and there is no shame in turning back early if you do not feel you can complete the hike.
results.name: Outdoor Adventure Hike & Networking at Tourne Park

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!

Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study, converse, and share good energy. We learn in a casual and fun way. 

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
